1.verse: Seeing that many did take in hand to set in order a  narration of the matters that have been fully assured among us,

2.verse: as they did deliver to us, who from the beginning became  eye-witnesses, and officers of the Word, --

3.verse: it seemed good also to me, having followed from the first  after all things exactly, to write to thee in order, most noble  Theophilus,

4.verse: that thou mayest know the certainty of the things wherein  thou wast instructed.

5.verse: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain  priest, by name Zacharias, of the course of Abijah, and his  wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name Elisabeth;

6.verse: and they were both righteous before God, going on in all the  commands and righteousnesses of the Lord blameless,

7.verse: and they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren,  and both were advanced in their days.

8.verse: And it came to pass, in his acting as priest, in the order  of his course before God,

9.verse: according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot was to  make perfume, having gone into the sanctuary of the Lord,

10.verse: and all the multitude of the people were praying without,  at the hour of the perfume.

11.verse: And there appeared to him a messenger of the Lord standing  on the right side of the altar of the perfume,

12.verse: and Zacharias, having seen, was troubled, and fear fell on  him;

13.verse: and the messenger said unto him, `Fear not, Zacharias, for  thy supplication was heard, and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear  a son to thee, and thou shalt call his name John,

14.verse: and there shall be joy to thee, and gladness, and many at  his birth shall joy,

15.verse: for he shall be great before the Lord, and wine and strong  drink he may not drink, and of the Holy Spirit he shall be  full, even from his mother's womb;

16.verse: and many of the sons of Israel he shall turn to the Lord  their God,

17.verse: and he shall go before Him, in the spirit and power of  Elijah, to turn hearts of fathers unto children, and  disobedient ones to the wisdom of righteous ones, to make  ready for the Lord, a people prepared.'

18.verse: And Zacharias said unto the messenger, `Whereby shall I  know this? for I am aged, and my wife is advanced in her  days?'

19.verse: And the messenger answering said to him, `I am Gabriel, who  have been standing near before God, and I was sent to speak  unto thee, and to proclaim these good news to thee,

20.verse: and lo, thou shalt be silent, and not able to speak, till  the day that these things shall come to pass, because thou  didst not believe my words, that shall be fulfilled in their  season.'

21.verse: And the people were waiting for Zacharias, and wondering at  his tarrying in the sanctuary,

22.verse: and having come out, he was not able to speak to them, and  they perceived that a vision he had seen in the sanctuary, and  he was beckoning to them, and did remain dumb.

23.verse: And it came to pass, when the days of his service were  fulfilled, he went away to his house,

24.verse: and after those days, his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid  herself five months, saying --

25.verse: `Thus hath the Lord done to me, in days in which He looked  upon [me], to take away my reproach among men.'

26.verse: And in the sixth month was the messenger Gabriel sent by  God, to a city of Galilee, the name of which [is] Nazareth,

27.verse: to a virgin, betrothed to a man, whose name [is] Joseph, of  the house of David, and the name of the virgin [is] Mary.

28.verse: And the messenger having come in unto her, said, `Hail,  favoured one, the Lord [is] with thee; blessed [art] thou  among women;'

29.verse: and she, having seen, was troubled at his word, and was  reasoning of what kind this salutation may be.

30.verse: And the messenger said to her, `Fear not, Mary, for thou  hast found favour with God;

31.verse: and lo, thou shalt conceive in the womb, and shalt bring  forth a son, and call his name Jesus;

32.verse: he shall be great, and Son of the Highest he shall be  called, and the Lord God shall give him the throne of David  his father,

33.verse: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob to the ages; and  of his reign there shall be no end.'

34.verse: And Mary said unto the messenger, `How shall this be,  seeing a husband I do not know?'

35.verse: And the messenger answering said to her, `The Holy Spirit  shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall  overshadow thee, therefore also the holy-begotten thing shall  be called Son of God;

36.verse: and lo, Elisabeth, thy kinswoman, she also hath conceived a  son in her old age, and this is the sixth month to her who was  called barren;

37.verse: because nothing shall be impossible with God.'

38.verse: And Mary said, `Lo, the maid-servant of the Lord; let it be  to me according to thy saying,' and the messenger went away  from her.

39.verse: And Mary having arisen in those days, went to the  hill-country, with haste, to a city of Judea,

40.verse: and entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted  Elisabeth.

41.verse: And it came to pass, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of  Mary, the babe did leap in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled  with the Holy Spirit,

42.verse: and spake out with a loud voice, and said, `Blessed [art]  thou among women, and blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb;

43.verse: and whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord  might come unto me?

44.verse: for, lo, when the voice of thy salutation came to my ears,  leap in gladness did the babe in my womb;

45.verse: and happy [is] she who did believe, for there shall be a  completion to the things spoken to her from the Lord.'

46.verse: And Mary said, `My soul doth magnify the Lord,

47.verse: And my spirit was glad on God my Saviour,

48.verse: Because He looked on the lowliness of His maid-servant,  For, lo, henceforth call me happy shall all the generations,

49.verse: For He who is mighty did to me great things, And holy [is]  His name,

50.verse: And His kindness [is] to generations of generations, To  those fearing Him,

51.verse: He did powerfully with His arm, He scattered abroad the  proud in the thought of their heart,

52.verse: He brought down the mighty from thrones, And He exalted the  lowly,

53.verse: The hungry He did fill with good, And the rich He sent away  empty,

54.verse: He received again Israel His servant, To remember kindness,

55.verse: As He spake unto our fathers, To Abraham and to his seed --  to the age.'

56.verse: And Mary remained with her about three months, and turned  back to her house.

57.verse: And to Elisabeth was the time fulfilled for her bringing  forth, and she bare a son,

58.verse: and the neighbours and her kindred heard that the Lord was  making His kindness great with her, and they were rejoicing  with her.

59.verse: And it came to pass, on the eighth day, they came to  circumcise the child, and they were calling him by the name of  his father, Zacharias,

60.verse: and his mother answering said, `No, but he shall be called  John.'

61.verse: And they said unto her -- `There is none among thy kindred  who is called by this name,'

62.verse: and they were making signs to his father, what he would  wish him to be called,

63.verse: and having asked for a tablet, he wrote, saying, `John is  his name;' and they did all wonder;

64.verse: and his mouth was opened presently, and his tongue, and he  was speaking, praising God.

65.verse: And fear came upon all those dwelling around them, and in  all the hill-country of Judea were all these sayings spoken of,

66.verse: and all who heard did lay them up in their hearts, saying,  `What then shall this child be?' and the hand of the Lord was  with him.

67.verse: And Zacharias his father was filled with the Holy Spirit,  and did prophesy, saying,

68.verse: `Blessed [is] the Lord, the God of Israel, Because He did  look upon, And wrought redemption for His people,

69.verse: And did raise an horn of salvation to us, In the house of  David His servant,

70.verse: As He spake by the mouth of His holy prophets, Which have  been from the age;

71.verse: Salvation from our enemies, And out of the hand of all  hating us,

72.verse: To do kindness with our fathers, And to be mindful of His  holy covenant,

73.verse: An oath that He sware to Abraham our father,

74.verse: To give to us, without fear, Out of the hand of our enemies  having been delivered,

75.verse: To serve Him, in holiness and righteousness Before Him, all  the days of our life.

76.verse: And thou, child, Prophet of the Highest Shalt thou be  called; For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord, To  prepare His ways.

77.verse: To give knowledge of salvation to His people In remission  of their sins,

78.verse: Through the tender mercies of our God, In which the rising  from on high did look upon us,

79.verse: To give light to those sitting in darkness and death-shade,  To guide our feet to a way of peace.'

80.verse: And the child grew, and was strengthened in spirit, and he  was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.

1.verse: And it came to pass in those days, there went forth a decree  from Caesar Augustus, that all the world be enrolled --

2.verse: this enrollment first came to pass when Cyrenius was  governor of Syria --

3.verse: and all were going to be enrolled, each to his proper city,

4.verse: and Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of  Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David, that is called  Bethlehem, because of his being of the house and family of  David,

5.verse: to enroll himself with Mary his betrothed wife, being with  child.

6.verse: And it came to pass, in their being there, the days were  fulfilled for her bringing forth,

7.verse: and she brought forth her son -- the first-born, and wrapped  him up, and laid him down in the manger, because there was not  for them a place in the guest-chamber.

8.verse: And there were shepherds in the same region, lodging in the  field, and keeping the night-watches over their flock,

9.verse: and lo, a messenger of the Lord stood over them, and the  glory of the Lord shone around them, and they feared a great  fear.

10.verse: And the messenger said to them, `Fear not, for lo, I bring  you good news of great joy, that shall be to all the people --

11.verse: because there was born to you to-day a Saviour -- who is  Christ the Lord -- in the city of David,

12.verse: and this [is] to you the sign: Ye shall find a babe wrapped  up, lying in the manger.'

13.verse: And suddenly there came with the messenger a multitude of  the heavenly host, praising God, and saying,

14.verse: `Glory in the highest to God, and upon earth peace, among  men -- good will.'

15.verse: And it came to pass, when the messengers were gone away  from them to the heavens, that the men, the shepherds, said  unto one another, `We may go over indeed unto Bethlehem, and  see this thing that hath come to pass, that the Lord did make  known to us.'

16.verse: And they came, having hasted, and found both Mary, and  Joseph, and the babe lying in the manger,

17.verse: and having seen, they made known abroad concerning the  saying spoken to them concerning the child.

18.verse: And all who heard, did wonder concerning the things spoken  by the shepherds unto them;

19.verse: and Mary was preserving all these things, pondering in her  heart;

20.verse: and the shepherds turned back, glorifying and praising God,  for all those things they heard and saw, as it was spoken unto  them.

21.verse: And when eight days were fulfilled to circumcise the child,  then was his name called Jesus, having been so called by the  messenger before his being conceived in the womb.

22.verse: And when the days of their purification were fulfilled,  according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to  Jerusalem, to present to the Lord,

23.verse: as it hath been written in the Law of the Lord, -- `Every  male opening a womb shall be called holy to the Lord,'

24.verse: and to give a sacrifice, according to that said in the Law  of the Lord, `A pair of turtle-doves, or two young pigeons.'

25.verse: And lo, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name [is]  Simeon, and this man is righteous and devout, looking for the  comforting of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him,

26.verse: and it hath been divinely told him by the Holy Spirit --  not to see death before he may see the Christ of the Lord.

27.verse: And he came in the Spirit to the temple, and in the parents  bringing in the child Jesus, for their doing according to the  custom of the law regarding him,

28.verse: then he took him in his arms, and blessed God, and he said,

29.verse: `Now Thou dost send away Thy servant, Lord, according to  Thy word, in peace,

30.verse: because mine eyes did see Thy salvation,

31.verse: which Thou didst prepare before the face of all the  peoples,

32.verse: a light to the uncovering of nations, and the glory of Thy  people Israel.'

33.verse: And Joseph and his mother were wondering at the things  spoken concerning him,

34.verse: and Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother,  `Lo, this [one] is set for the falling and rising again of many  in Israel, and for a sign spoken against --

35.verse: (and also thine own soul shall a sword pass through) --  that the reasonings of many hearts may be revealed.'

36.verse: And there was Anna, a prophetess, daughter of Phanuel, of  the tribe of Asher, she was much advanced in days, having  lived with an husband seven years from her virginity,

37.verse: and she [is] a widow of about eighty-four years, who did  depart not from the temple, with fasts and supplications  serving, night and day,

38.verse: and she, at that hour, having come in, was confessing,  likewise, to the Lord, and was speaking concerning him, to all  those looking for redemption in Jerusalem.

39.verse: And when they finished all things, according to the Law of  the Lord, they turned back to Galilee, to their city Nazareth;

40.verse: and the child grew and was strengthened in spirit, being  filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.

41.verse: And his parents were going yearly to Jerusalem, at the  feast of the passover,

42.verse: and when he became twelve years old, they having gone up to  Jerusalem, according to the custom of the feast,

43.verse: and having finished the days, in their returning the child  Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem, and Joseph and his mother  did not know,

44.verse: and, having supposed him to be in the company, they went a  day's journey, and were seeking him among the kindred and  among the acquaintances,

45.verse: and not having found him, they turned back to Jerusalem  seeking him.

46.verse: And it came to pass, after three days, they found him in  the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both hearing  them and questioning them,

47.verse: and all those hearing him were astonished at his  understanding and answers.

48.verse: And, having seen him, they were amazed, and his mother said  unto him, `Child, why didst thou thus to us? lo, thy father  and I, sorrowing, were seeking thee.'

49.verse: And he said unto them, `Why [is it] that ye were seeking  me? did ye not know that in the things of my Father it  behoveth me to be?'

50.verse: and they did not understand the saying that he spake to  them,

51.verse: and he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and he  was subject to them, and his mother was keeping all these  sayings in her heart,

52.verse: and Jesus was advancing in wisdom, and in stature, and in  favour with God and men.

1.verse: And in the fifteenth year of the government of Tiberius  Caesar -- Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod  tetrarch of Galilee, and Philip his brother, tetrarch of  Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch  of Abilene --

2.verse: Annas and Caiaphas being chief priests -- there came a word  of God unto John the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness,

3.verse: and he came to all the region round the Jordan, proclaiming  a baptism of reformation -- to remission of sins,

4.verse: as it hath been written in the scroll of the words of Isaiah  the prophet, saying, `A voice of one crying in the wilderness,  Prepare ye the way of the Lord, straight make ye His paths;

5.verse: every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill  shall be made low, and the crooked shall become straightness,  and the rough become smooth ways;

6.verse: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.'

7.verse: Then said he to the multitudes coming forth to be baptised  by him, `Brood of vipers! who did prompt you to flee from the  coming wrath?

8.verse: make, therefore, fruits worthy of the reformation, and begin  not to say within yourselves, We have a father -- Abraham; for  I say to you, that God is able out of these stones to raise  children to Abraham;

9.verse: and already also the axe unto the root of the trees is laid,  every tree, therefore, not making good fruit is cut down, and  to fire it is cast.'

10.verse: And the multitudes were questioning him, saying, `What,  then, shall we do?'

11.verse: and he answering saith to them, `He having two coats -- let  him impart to him having none, and he having victuals -- in  like manner let him do.'

12.verse: And there came also tax-gatherers to be baptised, and they  said unto him, `Teacher, what shall we do?'

13.verse: and he said unto them, `Exact no more than that directed  you.'

14.verse: And questioning him also were those warring, saying, `And  we, what shall we do?' and he said unto them, `Do violence to  no one, nor accuse falsely, and be content with your wages.'

15.verse: And the people are looking forward, and all are reasoning  in their hearts concerning John, whether or not he may be the  Christ;

16.verse: John answered, saying to all, `I indeed with water do  baptise you, but he cometh who is mightier than I, of whom I  am not worthy to loose the latchet of his sandals -- he shall  baptise you with the Holy Spirit and with fire;

17.verse: whose winnowing shovel [is] in his hand, and he will  thoroughly cleanse his floor, and will gather the wheat to his  storehouse, and the chaff he will burn with fire  unquenchable.'

18.verse: And, therefore, indeed with many other things, exhorting,  he was proclaiming good news to the people,

19.verse: and Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him concerning  Herodias the wife of Philip his brother, and concerning all  the evils that Herod did,

20.verse: added also this to all, that he shut up John in the prison.

21.verse: And it came to pass, in all the people being baptised,  Jesus also being baptised, and praying, the heaven was opened,

22.verse: and the Holy Spirit came down in a bodily appearance, as if  a dove, upon him, and a voice came out of heaven, saying,  `Thou art My Son -- the Beloved, in thee I did delight.'

23.verse: And Jesus himself was beginning to be about thirty years of  age, being, as was supposed, son of Joseph,

24.verse: the [son] of Eli, the [son] of Matthat, the [son] of Levi,  the [son] of Melchi, the [son] of Janna, the [son] of Joseph,

25.verse: the [son] of Mattathias, the [son] of Amos, the [son] of  Naum, the [son] of Esli,

26.verse: the [son] of Naggai, the [son] of Maath, the [son] of  Mattathias, the [son] of Semei, the [son] of Joseph, the [son]  of Juda,

27.verse: the [son] of Joanna, the [son] of Rhesa, the [son] of  Zerubbabel, the [son] of Shealtiel,

28.verse: the [son] of Neri, the [son] of Melchi, the [son] of Addi,  the [son] of Cosam, the [son] of Elmodam, the [son] of Er,

29.verse: the [son] of Jose, the [son] of Eliezer, the [son] of  Jorim, the [son] of Matthat,

30.verse: the [son] of Levi, the [son] of Simeon, the [son] of Juda,  the [son] of Joseph, the [son] of Jonan, the [son] of Eliakim,

31.verse: the [son] of Melea, the [son] of Mainan, the [son] of  Mattatha, the [son] of Nathan,

32.verse: the [son] of David, the [son] of Jesse, the [son] of Obed,  the [son] of Booz, the [son] of Salmon, the [son] of Nahshon,

33.verse: the [son] of Amminadab, the [son] of Aram, the [son] of  Esrom, the [son] of Pharez,

34.verse: the [son] of Judah, the [son] of Jacob, the [son] of Isaac,  the [son] of Abraham, the [son] of Terah, the [son] of Nahor,

35.verse: the [son] of Serug, the [son] of Reu, the [son] of Peleg,  the [son] of Eber,

36.verse: the [son] of Salah, the [son] of Cainan, the [son] of  Arphaxad, the [son] of Shem, the [son] of Noah, the [son] of  Lamech,

37.verse: the [son] of Methuselah, the [son] of Enoch, the [son] of  Jared, the [son] of Mahalaleel,

38.verse: the [son] of Cainan, the [son] of Enos, the [son] of Seth,  the [son] of Adam, the [son] of God.

1.verse: And Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, turned back from the  Jordan, and was brought in the Spirit to the wilderness,

2.verse: forty days being tempted by the Devil, and he did not eat  anything in those days, and they having been ended, he  afterward hungered,

3.verse: and the Devil said to him, `If Son thou art of God, speak to  this stone that it may become bread.'

4.verse: And Jesus answered him, saying, `It hath been written, that,  not on bread only shall man live, but on every saying of God.'

5.verse: And the Devil having brought him up to an high mountain,  shewed to him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of  time,

6.verse: and the Devil said to him, `To thee I will give all this  authority, and their glory, because to me it hath been  delivered, and to whomsoever I will, I do give it;

7.verse: thou, then, if thou mayest bow before me -- all shall be  thine.'

8.verse: And Jesus answering him said, `Get thee behind me,  Adversary, for it hath been written, Thou shalt bow before the  Lord thy God, and Him only thou shalt serve.'

9.verse: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle  of the temple, and said to him, `If the Son thou art of God,  cast thyself down hence,

10.verse: for it hath been written -- To His messengers He will give  charge concerning thee, to guard over thee,

11.verse: and -- On hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time  thou mayest dash against a stone thy foot.'

12.verse: And Jesus answering said to him -- `It hath been said, Thou  shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.'

13.verse: And having ended all temptation, the Devil departed from  him till a convenient season.

14.verse: And Jesus turned back in the power of the Spirit to  Galilee, and a fame went forth through all the region round  about concerning him,

15.verse: and he was teaching in their synagogues, being glorified by  all.

16.verse: And he came to Nazareth, where he hath been brought up, and  he went in, according to his custom, on the sabbath-day, to the  synagogue, and stood up to read;

17.verse: and there was given over to him a roll of Isaiah the  prophet, and having unfolded the roll, he found the place where  it hath been written:

18.verse: `The Spirit of the Lord [is] upon me, Because He did anoint  me; To proclaim good news to the poor, Sent me to heal the  broken of heart, To proclaim to captives deliverance, And to  blind receiving of sight, To send away the bruised with  deliverance,

19.verse: To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.'

20.verse: And having folded the roll, having given [it] back to the  officer, he sat down, and the eyes of all in the synagogue were  gazing on him.

21.verse: And he began to say unto them -- `To-day hath this writing  been fulfilled in your ears;'

22.verse: and all were bearing testimony to him, and were wondering  at the gracious words that are coming forth out of his mouth,  and they said, `Is not this the son of Joseph?'

23.verse: And he said unto them, `Certainly ye will say to me this  simile, Physician, heal thyself; as great things as we heard  done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country;'

24.verse: and he said, `Verily I say to you -- No prophet is accepted  in his own country;

25.verse: and of a truth I say to you, Many widows were in the days  of Elijah, in Israel, when the heaven was shut for three years  and six months, when great famine came on all the land,

26.verse: and unto none of them was Elijah sent, but -- to Sarepta of  Sidon, unto a woman, a widow;

27.verse: and many lepers were in the time of Elisha the prophet, in  Israel, and none of them was cleansed, but -- Naaman the  Syrian.'

28.verse: And all in the synagogue were filled with wrath, hearing  these things,

29.verse: and having risen, they put him forth without the city, and  brought him unto the brow of the hill on which their city had  been built -- to cast him down headlong,

30.verse: and he, having gone through the midst of them, went away.

31.verse: And he came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was  teaching them on the sabbaths,

32.verse: and they were astonished at his teaching, because his word  was with authority.

33.verse: And in the synagogue was a man, having a spirit of an  unclean demon, and he cried out with a great voice,

34.verse: saying, `Away, what -- to us and to thee, Jesus, O  Nazarene? thou didst come to destroy us; I have known thee who  thou art -- the Holy One of God.'

35.verse: And Jesus did rebuke him, saying, `Be silenced, and come  forth out of him;' and the demon having cast him into the  midst, came forth from him, having hurt him nought;

36.verse: and amazement came upon all, and they were speaking  together, with one another, saying, `What [is] this word, that  with authority and power he doth command the unclean spirits,  and they come forth?'

37.verse: and there was going forth a fame concerning him to every  place of the region round about.

38.verse: And having risen out of the synagogue, he entered into the  house of Simon, and the mother-in-law of Simon was pressed  with a great fever, and they did ask him about her,

39.verse: and having stood over her, he rebuked the fever, and it  left her, and presently, having risen, she was ministering to  them.

40.verse: And at the setting of the sun, all, as many as had any  ailing with manifold sicknesses, brought them unto him, and he  on each one of them [his] hands having put, did heal them.

41.verse: And demons also were coming forth from many, crying out and  saying -- `Thou art the Christ, the Son of God;' and rebuking,  he did not suffer them to speak, because they knew him to be  the Christ.

42.verse: And day having come, having gone forth, he went on to a  desert place, and the multitudes were seeking him, and they  came unto him, and were staying him -- not to go on from them,

43.verse: and he said unto them -- `Also to the other cities it  behoveth me to proclaim good news of the reign of God, because  for this I have been sent;'

44.verse: and he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

1.verse: And it came to pass, in the multitude pressing on him to  hear the word of God, that he was standing beside the lake of  Gennesaret,

2.verse: and he saw two boats standing beside the lake, and the  fishers, having gone away from them, were washing the nets,

3.verse: and having entered into one of the boats, that was Simon's,  he asked him to put back a little from the land, and having sat  down, was teaching the multitudes out of the boat.

4.verse: And when he left off speaking, he said unto Simon, `Put back  to the deep, and let down your nets for a draught;'

5.verse: and Simon answering said to him, `Master, through the whole  night, having laboured, we have taken nothing, but at thy  saying I will let down the net.'

6.verse: And having done this, they enclosed a great multitude of  fishes, and their net was breaking,

7.verse: and they beckoned to the partners, who [are] in the other  boat, having come, to help them; and they came, and filled both  the boats, so that they were sinking.

8.verse: And Simon Peter having seen, fell down at the knees of  Jesus, saying, `Depart from me, because I am a sinful man, O  lord;'

9.verse: for astonishment seized him, and all those with him, at the  draught of the fishes that they took,

10.verse: and in like manner also James and John, sons of Zebedee,  who were partners with Simon; and Jesus said unto Simon, `Fear  not, henceforth thou shalt be catching men;'

11.verse: and they, having brought the boats upon the land, having  left all, did follow him.

12.verse: And it came to pass, in his being in one of the cities,  that lo, a man full of leprosy, and having seen Jesus, having  fallen on [his] face, he besought him, saying, `Sir, if thou  mayest will, thou art able to cleanse me;'

13.verse: and having stretched forth [his] hand, he touched him,  having said, `I will; be thou cleansed;' and immediately the  leprosy went away from him.

14.verse: And he charged him to tell no one, `But, having gone away,  shew thyself to the priest, and bring near for thy cleansing  according as Moses directed, for a testimony to them;'

15.verse: but the more was the report going abroad concerning him,  and great multitudes were coming together to hear, and to be  healed by him of their infirmities,

16.verse: and he was withdrawing himself in the desert places and was  praying.

17.verse: And it came to pass, on one of the days, that he was  teaching, and there were sitting by Pharisees and teachers of  the Law, who were come out of every village of Galilee, and  Judea, and Jerusalem, and the power of the Lord was -- to heal  them.

18.verse: And lo, men bearing upon a couch a man, who hath been  struck with palsy, and they were seeking to bring him in, and  to place before him,

19.verse: and not having found by what way they may bring him in  because of the multitude, having gone up on the house-top,  through the tiles they let him down, with the little couch,  into the midst before Jesus,

20.verse: and he having seen their faith, said to him, `Man, thy sins  have been forgiven thee.'

21.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying,  `Who is this that doth speak evil words? who is able to  forgive sins, except God only?'

22.verse: And Jesus having known their reasonings, answering, said  unto them, `What reason ye in your hearts?

23.verse: which is easier -- to say, Thy sins have been forgiven  thee? or to say, Arise, and walk?

24.verse: `And that ye may know that the Son of Man hath authority  upon the earth to forgive sins -- (he said to the one struck  with palsy) -- I say to thee, Arise, and having taken up thy  little couch, be going on to thy house.'

25.verse: And presently having risen before them, having taken up  [that] on which he was lying, he went away to his house,  glorifying God,

26.verse: and astonishment took all, and they were glorifying God,  and were filled with fear, saying -- `We saw strange things  to-day.'

27.verse: And after these things he went forth, and beheld a  tax-gatherer, by name Levi, sitting at the tax-office, and said  to him, `Be following me;'

28.verse: and he, having left all, having arisen, did follow him.

29.verse: And Levi made a great entertainment to him in his house,  and there was a great multitude of tax-gatherers and others who  were with them reclining (at meat),

30.verse: and the scribes and the Pharisees among them were murmuring  at his disciples, saying, `Wherefore with tax-gatherers and  sinners do ye eat and drink?'

31.verse: And Jesus answering said unto them, `They who are well have  no need of a physician, but they that are ill:

32.verse: I came not to call righteous men, but sinners, to  reformation.'

33.verse: And they said unto him, `Wherefore do the disciples of John  fast often, and make supplications -- in like manner also  those of the Pharisees -- but thine do eat and drink?'

34.verse: And he said unto them, `Are ye able to make the sons of the  bride-chamber -- in the bridegroom being with them -- to fast?

35.verse: but days will come, and, when the bridegroom may be taken  away from them, then they shall fast in those days.'

36.verse: And he spake also a simile unto them -- `No one a patch of  new clothing doth put on old clothing, and if otherwise, the  new also doth make a rent, and with the old the patch doth not  agree, that [is] from the new.

37.verse: `And no one doth put new wine into old skins, and if  otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins, and itself will  be poured out, and the skins will be destroyed;

38.verse: but new wine into new skins is to be put, and both are  preserved together;

39.verse: and no one having drunk old [wine], doth immediately wish  new, for he saith, The old is better.'

1.verse: And it came to pass, on the second-first sabbath, as he is  going through the corn fields, that his disciples were plucking  the ears, and were eating, rubbing with the hands,

2.verse: and certain of the Pharisees said to them, `Why do ye that  which is not lawful to do on the sabbaths?'

3.verse: And Jesus answering said unto them, `Did ye not read even  this that David did, when he hungered, himself and those who  are with him,

4.verse: how he went into the house of God, and the loaves of the  presentation did take, and did eat, and gave also to those  with him, which it is not lawful to eat, except only to the  priests?'

5.verse: and he said to them, -- `The Son of Man is lord also of the  sabbath.'

6.verse: And it came to pass also, on another sabbath, that he goeth  into the synagogue, and teacheth, and there was there a man,  and his right hand was withered,

7.verse: and the scribes and the Pharisees were watching him, if on  the sabbath he will heal, that they might find an accusation  against him.

8.verse: And he himself had known their reasonings, and said to the  man having the withered hand, `Rise, and stand in the midst;'  and he having risen, stood.

9.verse: Then said Jesus unto them, `I will question you something:  Is it lawful on the sabbaths to do good, or to do evil? life  to save or to kill?'

10.verse: And having looked round on them all, he said to the man,  `Stretch forth thy hand;' and he did so, and his hand was  restored whole as the other;

11.verse: and they were filled with madness, and were speaking with  one another what they might do to Jesus.

12.verse: And it came to pass in those days, he went forth to the  mountain to pray, and was passing the night in the prayer of  God,

13.verse: and when it became day, he called near his disciples, and  having chosen from them twelve, whom also he named apostles,

14.verse: (Simon, whom also he named Peter, and Andrew his brother,  James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

15.verse: Matthew and Thomas, James of Alphaeus, and Simon called  Zelotes,

16.verse: Judas of James, and Judas Iscariot, who also became  betrayer;)

17.verse: and having come down with them, he stood upon a level spot,  and a crowd of his disciples, and a great multitude of the  people from all Judea, and Jerusalem, and the maritime Tyre and  Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their  sicknesses,

18.verse: and those harassed by unclean spirits, and they were  healed,

19.verse: and all the multitude were seeking to touch him, because  power from him was going forth, and he was healing all.

20.verse: And he, having lifted up his eyes to his disciples, said:  `Happy the poor -- because yours is the reign of God.

21.verse: `Happy those hungering now -- because ye shall be filled.  `Happy those weeping now -- because ye shall laugh.

22.verse: `Happy are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall  separate you, and shall reproach, and shall cast forth your  name as evil, for the Son of Man's sake --

23.verse: rejoice in that day, and leap, for lo, your reward [is]  great in the heaven, for according to these things were their  fathers doing to the prophets.

24.verse: `But wo to you -- the rich, because ye have got your  comfort.

25.verse: `Wo to you who have been filled -- because ye shall hunger.  `Wo to you who are laughing now -- because ye shall mourn and  weep.

26.verse: `Wo to you when all men shall speak well of you -- for  according to these things were their fathers doing to false  prophets.

27.verse: `But I say to you who are hearing, Love your enemies, do  good to those hating you,

28.verse: bless those cursing you, and pray for those accusing you  falsely;

29.verse: and to him smiting thee upon the cheek, give also the  other, and from him taking away from thee the mantle, also the  coat thou mayest not keep back.

30.verse: `And to every one who is asking of thee, be giving; and  from him who is taking away thy goods, be not asking again;

31.verse: and as ye wish that men may do to you, do ye also to them  in like manner;

32.verse: and -- if ye love those loving you, what grace have ye? for  also the sinful love those loving them;

33.verse: and if ye do good to those doing good to you, what grace  have ye? for also the sinful do the same;

34.verse: and if ye lend [to those] of whom ye hope to receive back,  what grace have ye? for also the sinful lend to sinners -- that  they may receive again as much.

35.verse: `But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for  nothing again, and your reward will be great, and ye shall be  sons of the Highest, because He is kind unto the ungracious and  evil;

36.verse: be ye therefore merciful, as also your Father is merciful.

37.verse: `And judge not, and ye may not be judged; condemn not, and  ye may not be condemned; release, and ye shall be released.

38.verse: `Give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed,  and shaken, and running over, they shall give into your bosom;  for with that measure with which ye measure, it shall be  measured to you again.'

39.verse: And he spake a simile to them, `Is blind able to lead  blind? shall they not both fall into a pit?

40.verse: A disciple is not above his teacher, but every one  perfected shall be as his teacher.

41.verse: `And why dost thou behold the mote that is in thy brother's  eye, and the beam that [is] in thine own eye dost not  consider?

42.verse: or how art thou able to say to thy brother, Brother,  suffer, I may take out the mote that [is] in thine eye --  thyself the beam in thine own eye not beholding? Hypocrite,  take first the beam out of thine own eye, and then thou shalt  see clearly to take out the mote that [is] in thy brother's  eye.

43.verse: `For there is not a good tree making bad fruit, nor a bad  tree making good fruit;

44.verse: for each tree from its own fruit is known, for not from  thorns do they gather figs, nor from a bramble do they crop a  grape.

45.verse: `The good man out of the good treasure of his heart doth  bring forth that which [is] good; and the evil man out of the  evil treasure of his heart doth bring forth that which [is]  evil; for out of the abounding of the heart doth his mouth  speak.

46.verse: `And why do ye call me, Lord, Lord, and do not what I say?

47.verse: Every one who is coming unto me, and is hearing my words,  and is doing them, I will shew you to whom he is like;

48.verse: he is like to a man building a house, who did dig, and  deepen, and laid a foundation upon the rock, and a flood  having come, the stream broke forth on that house, and was not  able to shake it, for it had been founded upon the rock.

49.verse: `And he who heard and did not, is like to a man having  builded a house upon the earth, without a foundation, against  which the stream brake forth, and immediately it fell, and the  ruin of that house became great.'

1.verse: And when he completed all his sayings in the ears of the  people, he went into Capernaum;

2.verse: and a certain centurion's servant being ill, was about to  die, who was much valued by him,

3.verse: and having heard about Jesus, he sent unto him elders of the  Jews, beseeching him, that having come he might thoroughly save  his servant.

4.verse: And they, having come near unto Jesus, were calling upon him  earnestly, saying -- `He is worthy to whom thou shalt do this,

5.verse: for he doth love our nation, and the synagogue he did build  to us.'

6.verse: And Jesus was going on with them, and now when he is not far  distant from the house the centurion sent unto him friends,  saying to him, `Sir, be not troubled, for I am not worthy that  under my roof thou mayest enter;

7.verse: wherefore not even myself thought I worthy to come unto  thee, but say in a word, and my lad shall be healed;

8.verse: for I also am a man placed under authority, having under  myself soldiers, and I say to this [one], Go, and he goeth;  and to another, Be coming, and he cometh; and to my servant,  Do this, and he doth [it].'

9.verse: And having heard these things Jesus wondered at him, and  having turned to the multitude following him, he said, `I say  to you, not even in Israel so much faith did I find;'

10.verse: and those sent, having turned back to the house, found the  ailing servant in health.

11.verse: And it came to pass, on the morrow, he was going on to a  city called Nain, and there were going with him many of his  disciples, and a great multitude,

12.verse: and as he came nigh to the gate of the city, then, lo, one  dead was being carried forth, an only son of his mother, and  she a widow, and a great multitude of the city was with her.

13.verse: And the Lord having seen her, was moved with compassion  towards her, and said to her, `Be not weeping;'

14.verse: and having come near, he touched the bier, and those  bearing [it] stood still, and he said, `Young man, to thee I  say, Arise;'

15.verse: and the dead sat up, and began to speak, and he gave him to  his mother;

16.verse: and fear took hold of all, and they were glorifying God,  saying -- `A great prophet hath risen among us,' and -- `God  did look upon His people.'

17.verse: And the account of this went forth in all Judea about him,  and in all the region around.

18.verse: And the disciples of John told him about all these things,

19.verse: and John having called near a certain two of his disciples,  sent unto Jesus, saying, `Art thou he who is coming, or for  another do we look?'

20.verse: And having come near to him, the men said, `John the  Baptist sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he who is coming,  or for another do we look?'

21.verse: And in that hour he cured many from sicknesses, and  plagues, and evil spirits, and to many blind he granted sight.

22.verse: And Jesus answering said to them, `Having gone on, report  to John what ye saw and heard, that blind men do see again,  lame do walk, lepers are cleansed, deaf do hear, dead are  raised, poor have good news proclaimed;

23.verse: and happy is he whoever may not be stumbled in me.'

24.verse: And the messengers of John having gone away, he began to  say unto the multitudes concerning John: `What have ye gone  forth to the wilderness to look on? a reed by the wind shaken?

25.verse: but what have ye gone forth to see? a man in soft garments  clothed? lo, they in splendid apparellings, and living in  luxury, are in the houses of kings!

26.verse: `But what have ye gone forth to see? a prophet? Yes, I say  to you, and much more than a prophet:

27.verse: this is he concerning whom it hath been written, Lo, I send  my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before  thee;

28.verse: for I say to you, a greater prophet, among those born of  women, than John the Baptist there is not; but the least in  the reign of God is greater than he.'

29.verse: And all the people having heard, and the tax-gatherers,  declared God righteous, having been baptized with the baptism  of John,

30.verse: but the Pharisees, and the lawyers, the counsel of God did  put away for themselves, not having been baptized by him.

31.verse: And the Lord said, `To what, then, shall I liken the men of  this generation? and to what are they like?

32.verse: they are like to children, to those sitting in a  market-place, and calling one to another, and saying, We piped  to you, and ye did not dance, we mourned to you, and ye did not  weep!

33.verse: `For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor  drinking wine, and ye say, He hath a demon;

34.verse: the Son of Man came eating and drinking, and ye say, Lo, a  man, a glutton, and a wine drinker, a friend of tax-gatherers  and sinners;

35.verse: and the wisdom was justified from all her children.'

36.verse: And a certain one of the Pharisees was asking him that he  might eat with him, and having gone into the house of the  Pharisee he reclined (at meat),

37.verse: and lo, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, having known  that he reclineth (at meat) in the house of the Pharisee,  having provided an alabaster box of ointment,

38.verse: and having stood behind, beside his feet, weeping, she  began to wet his feet with the tears, and with the hairs of  her head she was wiping, and was kissing his feet, and was  anointing with the ointment.

39.verse: And the Pharisee who did call him, having seen, spake  within himself, saying, `This one, if he were a prophet, would  have known who and of what kind [is] the woman who doth touch  him, that she is a sinner.'

40.verse: And Jesus answering said unto him, `Simon, I have something  to say to thee;' and he saith, `Teacher, say on.'

41.verse: `Two debtors were to a certain creditor; the one was owing  five hundred denaries, and the other fifty;

42.verse: and they not having [wherewith] to give back, he forgave  both; which then of them, say thou, will love him more?'

43.verse: And Simon answering said, `I suppose that to whom he  forgave the more;' and he said to him, `Rightly thou didst  judge.'

44.verse: And having turned unto the woman, he said to Simon, `Seest  thou this woman? I entered into thy house; water for my feet  thou didst not give, but this woman with tears did wet my  feet, and with the hairs of her head did wipe;

45.verse: a kiss to me thou didst not give, but this woman, from what  [time] I came in, did not cease kissing my feet;

46.verse: with oil my head thou didst not anoint, but this woman with  ointment did anoint my feet;

47.verse: therefore I say to thee, her many sins have been forgiven,  because she did love much; but to whom little is forgiven,  little he doth love.'

48.verse: And he said to her, `Thy sins have been forgiven;'

49.verse: and those reclining with him (at meat) began to say within  themselves, `Who is this, who also doth forgive sins?'

50.verse: and he said unto the woman, `Thy faith have saved thee, be  going on to peace.'

1.verse: And it came to pass thereafter, that he was going through  every city and village, preaching and proclaiming good news of  the reign of God, and the twelve [are] with him,

2.verse: and certain women, who were healed of evil spirits and  infirmities, Mary who is called Magdalene, from whom seven  demons had gone forth,

3.verse: and Joanna wife of Chuza, steward of Herod, and Susanna, and  many others, who were ministering to him from their substance.

4.verse: And a great multitude having gathered, and those who from  city and city were coming unto him, he spake by a simile:

5.verse: `The sower went forth to sow his seed, and in his sowing  some indeed fell beside the way, and it was trodden down, and  the fowls of the heaven did devour it.

6.verse: `And other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up, it did  wither, through not having moisture.

7.verse: `And other fell amidst the thorns, and the thorns having  sprung up with it, did choke it.

8.verse: `And other fell upon the good ground, and having sprung up,  it made fruit an hundred fold.' These things saying, he was  calling, `He having ears to hear -- let him hear.'

9.verse: And his disciples were questioning him, saying, `What may  this simile be?'

10.verse: And he said, `To you it hath been given to know the secrets  of the reign of God, and to the rest in similes; that seeing  they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

11.verse: `And this is the simile: The seed is the word of God,

12.verse: and those beside the way are those hearing, then cometh the  Devil, and taketh up the word from their heart, lest having  believed, they may be saved.

13.verse: `And those upon the rock: They who, when they may hear,  with joy do receive the word, and these have no root, who for a  time believe, and in time of temptation fall away.

14.verse: `And that which fell to the thorns: These are they who have  heard, and going forth, through anxieties, and riches, and  pleasures of life, are choked, and bear not to completion.

15.verse: `And that in the good ground: These are they, who in an  upright and good heart, having heard the word, do retain [it],  and bear fruit in continuance.

16.verse: `And no one having lighted a lamp doth cover it with a  vessel, or under a couch doth put [it]; but upon a lamp-stand  he doth put [it], that those coming in may see the light,

17.verse: for nothing is secret, that shall not become manifest, nor  hid, that shall not be known, and become manifest.

18.verse: `See, therefore, how ye hear, for whoever may have, there  shall be given to him, and whoever may not have, also what he  seemeth to have, shall be taken from him.'

19.verse: And there came unto him his mother and brethren, and they  were not able to get to him because of the multitude,

20.verse: and it was told him, saying, `Thy mother and thy brethren  do stand without, wishing to see thee;'

21.verse: and he answering said unto them, `My mother and my  brethren! they are those who the word of God are hearing, and  doing.'

22.verse: And it came to pass, on one of the days, that he himself  went into a boat with his disciples, and he said unto them,  `We may go over to the other side of the lake;' and they set  forth,

23.verse: and as they are sailing he fell deeply asleep, and there  came down a storm of wind to the lake, and they were filling,  and were in peril.

24.verse: And having come near, they awoke him, saying, `Master,  master, we perish;' and he, having arisen, rebuked the wind  and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and there came a  calm,

25.verse: and he said to them, `Where is your faith?' and they being  afraid did wonder, saying unto one another, `Who, then, is  this, that even the winds he doth command, and the water, and  they obey him?'

26.verse: And they sailed down to the region of the Gadarenes, that  is over-against Galilee,

27.verse: and he having gone forth upon the land, there met him a  certain man, out of the city, who had demons for a long time,  and with a garment was not clothed, and in a house was not  abiding, but in the tombs,

28.verse: and having seen Jesus, and having cried out, he fell before  him, and with a loud voice, said, `What -- to me and to thee,  Jesus, Son of God Most High? I beseech thee, mayest thou not  afflict me!'

29.verse: For he commanded the unclean spirit to come forth from the  man, for many times it had caught him, and he was being bound  with chains and fetters -- guarded, and breaking asunder the  bonds he was driven by the demons to the deserts.

30.verse: And Jesus questioned him, saying, `What is thy name?' and  he said, `Legion,' (because many demons were entered into him,)

31.verse: and he was calling on him, that he may not command them to  go away to the abyss,

32.verse: and there was there a herd of many swine feeding in the  mountain, and they were calling on him, that he might suffer  them to enter into these, and he suffered them,

33.verse: and the demons having gone forth from the man, did enter  into the swine, and the herd rushed down the steep to the lake,  and were choked.

34.verse: And those feeding [them], having seen what was come to  pass, fled, and having gone, told [it] to the city, and to the  fields;

35.verse: and they came forth to see what was come to pass, and they  came unto Jesus, and found the man sitting, out of whom the  demons had gone forth, clothed, and right-minded, at the feet  of Jesus, and they were afraid;

36.verse: and those also having seen [it], told them how the demoniac  was saved.

37.verse: And the whole multitude of the region of the Gadarenes  round about asked him to go away from them, because with great  fear they were pressed, and he having entered into the boat,  did turn back.

38.verse: And the man from whom the demons had gone forth was  beseeching of him to be with him, and Jesus sent him away,  saying,

39.verse: `Turn back to thy house, and tell how great things God did  to thee;' and he went away through all the city proclaiming  how great things Jesus did to him.

40.verse: And it came to pass, in the turning back of Jesus, the  multitude received him, for they were all looking for him,

41.verse: and lo, there came a man, whose name [is] Jairus, and he  was a chief of the synagogue, and having fallen at the feet of  Jesus, was calling on him to come to his house;

42.verse: because he had an only daughter about twelve years [old],  and she was dying. And in his going away, the multitudes were  thronging him,

43.verse: and a woman, having an issue of blood for twelve years,  who, having spent on physicians all her living, was not able to  be healed by any,

44.verse: having come near behind, touched the fringe of his garment,  and presently the issue of her blood stood.

45.verse: And Jesus said, `Who [is] it that touched me?' and all  denying, Peter and those with him said, `Master, the multitudes  press thee, and throng [thee], and thou dost say, Who [is] it  that touched me!'

46.verse: And Jesus said, `Some one did touch me, for I knew power  having gone forth from me.'

47.verse: And the woman, having seen that she was not hid, trembling,  came, and having fallen before him, for what cause she touched  him declared to him before all the people, and how she was  healed presently;

48.verse: and he said to her, `Take courage, daughter, thy faith hath  saved thee, be going on to peace.'

49.verse: While he is yet speaking, there doth come a certain one  from the chief of the synagogue's [house], saying to him --  `Thy daughter hath died, harass not the Teacher;'

50.verse: and Jesus having heard, answered him, saying, `Be not  afraid, only believe, and she shall be saved.'

51.verse: And having come to the house, he suffered no one to go in,  except Peter, and James, and John, and the father of the child,  and the mother;

52.verse: and they were all weeping, and beating themselves for her,  and he said, `Weep not, she did not die, but doth sleep;

53.verse: and they were deriding him, knowing that she did die;

54.verse: and he having put all forth without, and having taken hold  of her hand, called, saying, `Child, arise;'

55.verse: and her spirit came back, and she arose presently, and he  directed that there be given to her to eat;

56.verse: and her parents were amazed, but he charged them to say to  no one what was come to pass.

1.verse: And having called together his twelve disciples, he gave  them power and authority over all the demons, and to cure  sicknesses,

2.verse: and he sent them to proclaim the reign of God, and to heal  the ailing.

3.verse: And he said unto them, `Take nothing for the way, neither  staff, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats  each;

4.verse: and into whatever house ye may enter, there remain, and  thence depart;

5.verse: and as many as may not receive you, going forth from that  city, even the dust from your feet shake off, for a testimony  against them.'

6.verse: And going forth they were going through the several  villages, proclaiming good news, and healing everywhere.

7.verse: And Herod the tetrarch heard of all the things being done by  him, and was perplexed, because it was said by certain, that  John hath been raised out of the dead;

8.verse: and by certain, that Elijah did appear, and by others, that  a prophet, one of the ancients, was risen;

9.verse: and Herod said, `John I did behead, but who is this  concerning whom I hear such things?' and he was seeking to see  him.

10.verse: And the apostles having turned back, declared to him how  great things they did, and having taken them, he withdrew by  himself to a desert place of a city called Bethsaida,

11.verse: and the multitudes having known did follow him, and having  received them, he was speaking to them concerning the reign of  God, and those having need of service he cured.

12.verse: And the day began to decline, and the twelve having come  near, said to him, `Let away the multitude, that having gone  to the villages and the fields round about, they may lodge and  may find provision, because here we are in a desert place.'

13.verse: And he said unto them, `Give ye them to eat;' and they  said, `We have no more than five loaves, and two fishes:  except, having gone, we may buy for all this people victuals;'

14.verse: for they were about five thousand men. And he said unto his  disciples, `Cause them to recline in companies, in each fifty;'

15.verse: and they did so, and made all to recline;

16.verse: and having taken the five loaves, and the two fishes,  having looked up to the heaven, he blessed them, and brake, and  was giving to the disciples to set before the multitude;

17.verse: and they did eat, and were all filled, and there was taken  up what was over to them of broken pieces, twelve baskets.

18.verse: And it came to pass, as he is praying alone, the disciples  were with him, and he questioned them, saying, `Who do the  multitudes say me to be?'

19.verse: And they answering said, `John the Baptist; and others,  Elijah; and others, that a prophet, one of the ancients, was  risen;'

20.verse: and he said to them, `And ye -- who do ye say me to be?'  and Peter answering said, `The Christ of God.'

21.verse: And having charged them, he commanded [them] to say this to  no one,

22.verse: saying -- `It behoveth the Son of Man to suffer many  things, and to be rejected by the elders, and chief priests,  and scribes, and to be killed, and the third day to be raised.'

23.verse: And he said unto all, `If any one doth will to come after  me, let him disown himself, and take up his cross daily, and  follow me;

24.verse: for whoever may will to save his life, shall lose it, and  whoever may lose his life for my sake, he shall save it;

25.verse: for what is a man profited, having gained the whole world,  and having lost or having forfeited himself?

26.verse: `For whoever may be ashamed of me, and of my words, of this  one shall the Son of Man be ashamed, when he may come in his  glory, and the Father's, and the holy messengers';

27.verse: and I say to you, truly, there are certain of those here  standing, who shall not taste of death till they may see the  reign of God.'

28.verse: And it came to pass, after these words, as it were eight  days, that having taken Peter, and John, and James, he went up  to the mountain to pray,

29.verse: and it came to pass, in his praying, the appearance of his  face became altered, and his garment white -- sparkling.

30.verse: And lo, two men were speaking together with him, who were  Moses and Elijah,

31.verse: who having appeared in glory, spake of his outgoing that he  was about to fulfil in Jerusalem,

32.verse: but Peter and those with him were heavy with sleep, and  having waked, they saw his glory, and the two men standing  with him.

33.verse: And it came to pass, in their parting from him, Peter said  unto Jesus, `Master, it is good to us to be here; and we may  make three booths, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one  for Elijah,' not knowing what he saith:

34.verse: and as he was speaking these things, there came a cloud,  and overshadowed them, and they feared in their entering into  the cloud,

35.verse: and a voice came out of the cloud saying, `This is My Son  -- the Beloved; hear ye him;'

36.verse: and when the voice was past, Jesus was found alone; and  they were silent, and declared to no one in those days  anything of what they have seen.

37.verse: And it came to pass on the next day, they having come down  from the mount, there met him a great multitude,

38.verse: and lo, a man from the multitude cried out, saying,  `Teacher, I beseech thee, look upon my son, because he is my  only begotten;

39.verse: and lo, a spirit doth take him, and suddenly he doth cry  out, and it teareth him, with foaming, and it hardly departeth  from him, bruising him,

40.verse: and I besought thy disciples that they might cast it out,  and they were not able.'

41.verse: And Jesus answering said, `O generation, unstedfast and  perverse, till when shall I be with you, and suffer you? bring  near hither thy son;'

42.verse: and as he is yet coming near, the demon rent him, and tore  [him] sore, and Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed  the youth, and gave him back to his father.

43.verse: And they were all amazed at the greatness of God, and while  all are wondering at all things that Jesus did, he said unto  his disciples,

44.verse: `Lay ye to your ears these words, for the Son of Man is  about to be delivered up to the hands of men.'

45.verse: And they were not knowing this saying, and it was veiled  from them, that they might not perceive it, and they were  afraid to ask him about this saying.

46.verse: And there entered a reasoning among them, this, Who may be  greater of them?

47.verse: and Jesus having seen the reasoning of their heart, having  taken hold of a child, set him beside himself,

48.verse: and said to them, `Whoever may receive this child in my  name, doth receive me, and whoever may receive me, doth receive  Him who sent me, for he who is least among you all -- he shall  be great.'

49.verse: And John answering said, `Master, we saw a certain one in  thy name casting forth the demons, and we forbade him, because  he doth not follow with us;'

50.verse: and Jesus said unto him, `Forbid not, for he who is not  against us, is for us.'

51.verse: And it came to pass, in the completing of the days of his  being taken up, that he fixed his face to go on to Jerusalem,

52.verse: and he sent messengers before his face, and having gone on,  they went into a village of Samaritans, to make ready for him,

53.verse: and they did not receive him, because his face was going on  to Jerusalem.

54.verse: And his disciples James and John having seen, said, `Sir,  wilt thou [that] we may command fire to come down from the  heaven, and to consume them, as also Elijah did?'

55.verse: and having turned, he rebuked them, and said, `Ye have not  known of what spirit ye are;

56.verse: for the Son of Man did not come to destroy men's lives, but  to save;' and they went on to another village.

57.verse: And it came to pass, as they are going on in the way, a  certain one said unto him, `I will follow thee wherever thou  mayest go, sir;'

58.verse: and Jesus said to him, `The foxes have holes, and the fowls  of the heaven places of rest, but the Son of Man hath not  where he may recline the head.'

59.verse: And he said unto another, `Be following me;' and he said,  `Sir, permit me, having gone away, first to bury my father;'

60.verse: and Jesus said to him, `Suffer the dead to bury their own  dead, and thou, having gone away, publish the reign of God.'

61.verse: And another also said, `I will follow thee, sir, but first  permit me to take leave of those in my house;'

62.verse: and Jesus said unto him, `No one having put his hand on a  plough, and looking back, is fit for the reign of God.'

1.verse: And after these things, the Lord did appoint also other  seventy, and sent them by twos before his face, to every city  and place whither he himself was about to come,

2.verse: then said he unto them, `The harvest indeed [is] abundant,  but the workmen few; beseech ye then the Lord of the harvest,  that He may put forth workmen to His harvest.

3.verse: `Go away; lo, I send you forth as lambs in the midst of  wolves;

4.verse: carry no bag, no scrip, nor sandals; and salute no one on  the way;

5.verse: and into whatever house ye do enter, first say, Peace to  this house;

6.verse: and if indeed there may be there the son of peace, rest on  it shall your peace; and if not so, upon you it shall turn  back.

7.verse: `And in that house remain, eating and drinking the things  they have, for worthy [is] the workman of his hire; go not from  house to house,

8.verse: and into whatever city ye enter, and they may receive you,  eat the things set before you,

9.verse: and heal the ailing in it, and say to them, The reign of  God hath come nigh to you.

10.verse: `And into whatever city ye do enter, and they may not  receive you, having gone forth to its broad places, say,

11.verse: And the dust that hath cleaved to us, from your city, we  do wipe off against you, but this know ye, that the reign of  God hath come nigh to you;

12.verse: and I say to you, that for Sodom in that day it shall be  more tolerable than for that city.

13.verse: `Wo to thee, Chorazin; wo to thee, Bethsaida; for if in  Tyre and Sidon had been done the mighty works that were done  in you, long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes, they had  reformed;

14.verse: but for Tyre and Sidon it shall be more tolerable in the  judgment than for you.

15.verse: `And thou, Capernaum, which unto the heaven wast exalted,  unto hades thou shalt be brought down.

16.verse: `He who is hearing you, doth hear me; and he who is  putting you away, doth put me away; and he who is putting me  away, doth put away Him who sent me.'

17.verse: And the seventy turned back with joy, saying, `Sir, and  the demons are being subjected to us in thy name;'

18.verse: and he said to them, `I was beholding the Adversary, as  lightning from the heaven having fallen;

19.verse: lo, I give to you the authority to tread upon serpents and  scorpions, and on all the power of the enemy, and nothing by  any means shall hurt you;

20.verse: but, in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subjected  to you, but rejoice rather that your names were written in the  heavens.'

21.verse: In that hour was Jesus glad in the Spirit, and said, `I do  confess to thee, Father, Lord of the heaven and of the earth,  that Thou didst hide these things from wise men and  understanding, and didst reveal them to babes; yes, Father,  because so it became good pleasure before Thee.

22.verse: `All things were delivered up to me by my Father, and no  one doth know who the Son is, except the Father, and who the  Father is, except the Son, and he to whom the Son may wish to  reveal [Him].'

23.verse: And having turned unto the disciples, he said, by  themselves, `Happy the eyes that are perceiving what ye  perceive;

24.verse: for I say to you, that many prophets and kings did wish to  see what ye perceive, and did not see, and to hear what ye  hear, and did not hear.'

25.verse: And lo, a certain lawyer stood up, trying him, and saying,  `Teacher, what having done, life age-during shall I inherit?'

26.verse: And he said unto him, `In the law what hath been written?  how dost thou read?'

27.verse: And he answering said, `Thou shalt love the Lord thy God  out of all thy heart, and out of all thy soul, and out of all  thy strength, and out of all thy understanding, and thy  neighbour as thyself.'

28.verse: And he said to him, `Rightly thou didst answer; this do,  and thou shalt live.'

29.verse: And he, willing to declare himself righteous, said unto  Jesus, `And who is my neighbour?'

30.verse: and Jesus having taken up [the word], said, `A certain man  was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among  robbers, and having stripped him and inflicted blows, they went  away, leaving [him] half dead.

31.verse: `And by a coincidence a certain priest was going down in  that way, and having seen him, he passed over on the opposite  side;

32.verse: and in like manner also, a Levite, having been about the  place, having come and seen, passed over on the opposite side.

33.verse: `But a certain Samaritan, journeying, came along him, and  having seen him, he was moved with compassion,

34.verse: and having come near, he bound up his wounds, pouring on  oil and wine, and having lifted him up on his own beast, he  brought him to an inn, and was careful of him;

35.verse: and on the morrow, going forth, taking out two denaries,  he gave to the innkeeper, and said to him, Be careful of him,  and whatever thou mayest spend more, I, in my coming again,  will give back to thee.

36.verse: `Who, then, of these three, seemeth to thee to have become  neighbour of him who fell among the robbers?'

37.verse: and he said, `He who did the kindness with him,' then  Jesus said to him, `Be going on, and thou be doing in like  manner.'

38.verse: And it came to pass, in their going on, that he entered  into a certain village, and a certain woman, by name Martha,  did receive him into her house,

39.verse: and she had also a sister, called Mary, who also, having  seated herself beside the feet of Jesus, was hearing the word,

40.verse: and Martha was distracted about much serving, and having  stood by him, she said, `Sir, dost thou not care that my sister  left me alone to serve? say then to her, that she may partake  along with me.'

41.verse: And Jesus answering said to her, `Martha, Martha, thou art  anxious and disquieted about many things,

42.verse: but of one thing there is need, and Mary the good part did  choose, that shall not be taken away from her.'

1.verse: And it came to pass, in his being in a certain place  praying, as he ceased, a certain one of his disciples said  unto him, `Sir, teach us to pray, as also John taught his  disciples.'

2.verse: And he said to them, `When ye may pray, say ye: Our Father  who art in the heavens; hallowed be Thy name: Thy reign come;  Thy will come to pass, as in heaven also on earth;

3.verse: our appointed bread be giving us daily;

4.verse: and forgive us our sins, for also we ourselves forgive  every one indebted to us; and mayest Thou not bring us into  temptation; but do Thou deliver us from the evil.'

5.verse: And he said unto them, `Who of you shall have a friend, and  shall go on unto him at midnight, and may say to him, Friend,  lend me three loaves,

6.verse: seeing a friend of mine came out of the way unto me, and I  have not what I shall set before him,

7.verse: and he from within answering may say, Do not give me  trouble, already the door hath been shut, and my children with  me are in the bed, I am not able, having risen, to give to  thee.

8.verse: `I say to you, even if he will not give to him, having  risen, because of his being his friend, yet because of his  importunity, having risen, he will give him as many as he doth  need;

9.verse: and I say to you, Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek,  and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you;

10.verse: for every one who is asking doth receive; and he who is  seeking doth find; and to him who is knocking it shall be  opened.

11.verse: `And of which of you -- the father -- if the son shall ask  a loaf, a stone will he present to him? and if a fish, will he  instead of a fish, a serpent present to him?

12.verse: and if he may ask an egg, will he present to him a  scorpion?

13.verse: If, then, ye, being evil, have known good gifts to be  giving to your children, how much more shall the Father who is  from heaven give the Holy Spirit to those asking Him!'

14.verse: And he was casting forth a demon, and it was dumb, and it  came to pass, the demon having gone forth, the dumb man spake,  and the multitudes wondered,

15.verse: and certain of them said, `By Beelzeboul, ruler of the  demons, he doth cast forth the demons;'

16.verse: and others, tempting, a sign out of heaven from him were  asking.

17.verse: And he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, `Every  kingdom having been divided against itself is desolated; and  house against house doth fall;

18.verse: and if also the Adversary against himself was divided, how  shall his kingdom be made to stand? for ye say, by Beelzeboul  is my casting forth the demons.

19.verse: `But if I by Beelzeboul cast forth the demons -- your  sons, by whom do they cast forth? because of this your judges  they shall be;

20.verse: but if by the finger of God I cast forth the demons, then  come unawares upon you did the reign of God.

21.verse: `When the strong man armed may keep his hall, in peace are  his goods;

22.verse: but when the stronger than he, having come upon [him], may  overcome him, his whole-armour he doth take away in which he  had trusted, and his spoils he distributeth;

23.verse: he who is not with me is against me, and he who is not  gathering with me doth scatter.

24.verse: `When the unclean spirit may go forth from the man it  walketh through waterless places seeking rest, and not  finding, it saith, I will turn back to my house whence I came  forth;

25.verse: and having come, it findeth [it] swept and adorned;

26.verse: then doth it go, and take to it seven other spirits more  evil than itself, and having entered, they dwell there, and  the last of that man becometh worst than the first.'

27.verse: And it came to pass, in his saying these things, a certain  woman having lifted up the voice out of the multitude, said to  him, `Happy the womb that carried thee, and the paps that thou  didst suck!'

28.verse: And he said, `Yea, rather, happy those hearing the word of  God, and keeping [it]!'

29.verse: And the multitudes crowding together upon him, he began to  say, `This generation is evil, a sign it doth seek after, and a  sign shall not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah the  prophet,

30.verse: for as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also shall  the Son of Man be to this generation.

31.verse: `A queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with  the men of this generation, and shall condemn them, because she  came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon;  and lo, greater than Solomon here!

32.verse: `Men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this  generation, and shall condemn it, because they reformed at the  proclamation of Jonah; and lo, greater than Jonah here!

33.verse: `And no one having lighted a lamp, doth put [it] in a  secret place, nor under the measure, but on the lamp-stand,  that those coming in may behold the light.

34.verse: `The lamp of the body is the eye, when then thine eye may  be simple, thy whole body also is lightened; and when it may be  evil, thy body also is darkened;

35.verse: take heed, then, lest the light that [is] in thee be  darkness;

36.verse: if then thy whole body is lightened, not having any part  darkened, the whole shall be lightened, as when the lamp by the  brightness may give thee light.'

37.verse: And in [his] speaking, a certain Pharisee was asking him  that he might dine with him, and having gone in, he reclined  (at meat),

38.verse: and the Pharisee having seen, did wonder that he did not  first baptize himself before the dinner.

39.verse: And the Lord said unto him, `Now do ye, the Pharisees, the  outside of the cup and of the plate make clean, but your  inward part is full of rapine and wickedness;

40.verse: unthinking! did not He who made the outside also the  inside make?

41.verse: But what ye have give ye [as] alms, and, lo, all things  are clean to you.

42.verse: `But wo to you, the Pharisees, because ye tithe the mint,  and the rue, and every herb, and ye pass by the judgment, and  the love of God; these things it behoveth to do, and those not  to be neglecting.

43.verse: `Wo to you, the Pharisees, because ye love the first seats  in the synagogues, and the salutations in the market-places.

44.verse: `Wo to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because ye  are as the unseen tombs, and the men walking above have not  known.'

45.verse: And one of the lawyers answering, saith to him, `Teacher,  these things saying, us also thou dost insult;'

46.verse: and he said, `And to you, the lawyers, wo! because ye  burden men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye  yourselves with one of your fingers do not touch the burdens.

47.verse: `Wo to you, because ye build the tombs of the prophets,  and your fathers killed them.

48.verse: Then do ye testify, and are well pleased with the works of  your fathers, because they indeed killed them, and ye do build  their tombs;

49.verse: because of this also the wisdom of God said: I will send  to them prophets, and apostles, and some of them they shall  kill and persecute,

50.verse: that the blood of all the prophets, that is being poured  forth from the foundation of the world, may be required from  this generation;

51.verse: from the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, who  perished between the altar and the house; yes, I say to you, It  shall be required from this generation.

52.verse: `Wo to you, the lawyers, because ye took away the key of  the knowledge; yourselves ye did not enter; and those coming  in, ye did hinder.'

53.verse: And in his speaking these things unto them, the scribes  and the Pharisees began fearfully to urge and to press him to  speak about many things,

54.verse: laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of  his mouth, that they might accuse him.

1.verse: At which time the myriads of the multitude having been  gathered together, so as to tread upon one another, he began  to say unto his disciples, first, `Take heed to yourselves of  the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy;

2.verse: and there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed;  and hid, that shall not be known;

3.verse: because whatever in the darkness ye said, in the light  shall be heard: and what to the ear ye spake in the  inner-chambers, shall be proclaimed upon the house-tops.

4.verse: `And I say to you, my friends, be not afraid of those  killing the body, and after these things are not having  anything over to do;

5.verse: but I will show to you, whom ye may fear; Fear him who,  after the killing, is having authority to cast to the gehenna;  yes, I say to you, Fear ye Him.

6.verse: `Are not five sparrows sold for two assars? and one of them  is not forgotten before God,

7.verse: but even the hairs of your head have been all numbered;  therefore fear ye not, than many sparrows ye are of more value.

8.verse: `And I say to you, Every one -- whoever may confess with me  before men, the Son of Man also shall confess with him before  the messengers of God,

9.verse: and he who hath denied me before men, shall be denied  before the messengers of God,

10.verse: and every one whoever shall say a word to the Son of Man,  it shall be forgiven to him, but to him who to the Holy Spirit  did speak evil, it shall not be forgiven.

11.verse: `And when they bring you before the synagogues, and the  rulers, and the authorities, be not anxious how or what ye may  reply, or what ye may say,

12.verse: for the Holy Spirit shall teach you in that hour what it  behoveth [you] to say.'

13.verse: And a certain one said to him, out of the multitude,  `Teacher, say to my brother to divide with me the  inheritance.'

14.verse: And he said to him, `Man, who set me a judge or a divider  over you?'

15.verse: And he said unto them, `Observe, and beware of the  covetousness, because not in the abundance of one's goods is  his life.'

16.verse: And he spake a simile unto them, saying, `Of a certain  rich man the field brought forth well;

17.verse: and he was reasoning within himself, saying, What shall I  do, because I have not where I shall gather together my  fruits?

18.verse: and he said, This I will do, I will take down my  storehouses, and greater ones I will build, and I will gather  together there all my products and my good things,
