19.verse: and I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast many good  things laid up for many years, be resting, eat, drink, be  merry.

20.verse: `And God said to him, Unthinking one! this night thy soul  they shall require from thee, and what things thou didst  prepare -- to whom shall they be?

21.verse: so [is] he who is treasuring up to himself, and is not  rich toward God.'

22.verse: And he said unto his disciples, `Because of this, to you I  say, Be not anxious for your life, what ye may eat; nor for  the body, what ye may put on;

23.verse: the life is more than the nourishment, and the body than  the clothing.

24.verse: `Consider the ravens, that they sow not, nor reap, to  which there is no barn nor storehouse, and God doth nourish  them; how much better are ye than the fowls?

25.verse: and who of you, being anxious, is able to add to his age  one cubit?

26.verse: If, then, ye are not able for the least -- why for the  rest are ye anxious?

27.verse: `Consider the lilies, how do they grow? they labour not,  nor do they spin, and I say to you, not even Solomon in all his  glory was arrayed as one of these;

28.verse: and if the herbage in the field, that to-day is, and  to-morrow into an oven is cast, God doth so clothe, how much  more you -- ye of little faith?

29.verse: `And ye -- seek not what ye may eat, or what ye may drink,  and be not in suspense,

30.verse: for all these things do the nations of the world seek  after, and your Father hath known that ye have need of these  things;

31.verse: but, seek ye the reign of God, and all these things shall  be added to you.

32.verse: `Fear not, little flock, because your Father did delight  to give you the reign;

33.verse: sell your goods, and give alms, make to yourselves bags  that become not old, a treasure unfailing in the heavens,  where thief doth not come near, nor moth destroy;

34.verse: for where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.

35.verse: `Let your loins be girded, and the lamps burning,

36.verse: and ye like to men waiting for their lord, when he shall  return out of the wedding feasts, that he having come and  knocked, immediately they may open to him.

37.verse: `Happy those servants, whom the lord, having come, shall  find watching; verily I say to you, that he will gird himself,  and will cause them to recline (at meat), and having come  near, will minister to them;

38.verse: and if he may come in the second watch, and in the third  watch he may come, and may find [it] so, happy are those  servants.

39.verse: `And this know, that if the master of the house had known  what hour the thief doth come, he would have watched, and  would not have suffered his house to be broken through;

40.verse: and ye, then, become ye ready, because at the hour ye  think not, the Son of Man doth come.'

41.verse: And Peter said to him, `Sir, unto us this simile dost thou  speak, or also unto all?'

42.verse: And the Lord said, `Who, then, is the faithful and prudent  steward whom the lord shall set over his household, to give in  season the wheat measure?

43.verse: Happy that servant, whom his lord, having come, shall find  doing so;

44.verse: truly I say to you, that over all his goods he will set  him.

45.verse: `And if that servant may say in his heart, My lord doth  delay to come, and may begin to beat the men-servants and the  maid-servants, to eat also, and to drink, and to be drunken;

46.verse: the lord of that servant will come in a day in which he  doth not look for [him], and in an hour that he doth not know,  and will cut him off, and his portion with the unfaithful he  will appoint.

47.verse: `And that servant, who having known his lord's will, and  not having prepared, nor having gone according to his will,  shall be beaten with many stripes,

48.verse: and he who, not having known, and having done things  worthy of stripes, shall be beaten with few; and to every one  to whom much was given, much shall be required from him; and  to whom they did commit much, more abundantly they will ask of  him.

49.verse: `Fire I came to cast to the earth, and what will I if  already it was kindled?

50.verse: but I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how am I  pressed till it may be completed!

51.verse: `Think ye that peace I came to give in the earth? no, I  say to you, but rather division;

52.verse: for there shall be henceforth five in one house divided --  three against two, and two against three;

53.verse: a father shall be divided against a son, and a son against  a father, a mother against a daughter, and a daughter against a  mother, a mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and a  daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.'

54.verse: And he said also to the multitudes, `When ye may see the  cloud rising from the west, immediately ye say, A shower doth  come, and it is so;

55.verse: and when -- a south wind blowing, ye say, that there will  be heat, and it is;

56.verse: hypocrites! the face of the earth and of the heaven ye  have known to make proof of, but this time -- how do ye not  make proof of [it]?

57.verse: `And why, also, of yourselves, judge ye not what is  righteous?

58.verse: for, as thou art going away with thy opponent to the  ruler, in the way give diligence to be released from him, lest  he may drag thee unto the judge, and the judge may deliver  thee to the officer, and the officer may cast thee into  prison;

59.verse: I say to thee, thou mayest not come forth thence till even  the last mite thou mayest give back.'

1.verse: And there were present certain at that time, telling him  about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate did mingle with their  sacrifices;

2.verse: and Jesus answering said to them, `Think ye that these  Galileans became sinners beyond all the Galileans, because  they have suffered such things?

3.verse: No -- I say to you, but, if ye may not reform, all ye even  so shall perish.

4.verse: `Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and  killed them; think ye that these became debtors beyond all men  who are dwelling in Jerusalem?

5.verse: No -- I say to you, but, if ye may not reform, all ye in  like manner shall perish.'

6.verse: And he spake this simile: `A certain one had a fig-tree  planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit in it, and  he did not find;

7.verse: and he said unto the vine-dresser, Lo, three years I come  seeking fruit in this fig-tree, and do not find, cut it off,  why also the ground doth it render useless?

8.verse: `And he answering saith to him, Sir, suffer it also this  year, till that I may dig about it, and cast in dung;

9.verse: and if indeed it may bear fruit --; and if not so,  thereafter thou shalt cut it off.'

10.verse: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the  sabbath,

11.verse: and lo, there was a woman having a spirit of infirmity  eighteen years, and she was bowed together, and not able to  bend back at all,

12.verse: and Jesus having seen her, did call [her] near, and said  to her, `Woman, thou hast been loosed from thy infirmity;'

13.verse: and he laid on her [his] hands, and presently she was set  upright, and was glorifying God.

14.verse: And the chief of the synagogue answering -- much  displeased that on the sabbath Jesus healed -- said to the  multitude, `Six days there are in which it behoveth [us] to be  working; in these, then, coming, be healed, and not on the  sabbath-day.'

15.verse: Then the Lord answered him and said, `Hypocrite, doth not  each of you on the sabbath loose his ox or ass from the stall,  and having led away, doth water [it]?

16.verse: and this one, being a daughter of Abraham, whom the  Adversary bound, lo, eighteen years, did it not behove to be  loosed from this bond on the sabbath-day?'

17.verse: And he saying these things, all who were opposed to him  were being ashamed, and all the multitude were rejoicing over  all the glorious things that are being done by him.

18.verse: And he said, `To what is the reign of God like? and to  what shall I liken it?

19.verse: It is like to a grain of mustard, which a man having  taken, did cast into his garden, and it increased, and came to  a great tree, and the fowls of the heavens did rest in its  branches.'

20.verse: And again he said, `To what shall I liken the reign of  God?

21.verse: It is like leaven, which a woman, having taken, did hide  in three measures of meal, till that all was leavened.'

22.verse: And he was going through cities and villages, teaching,  and making progress toward Jerusalem;

23.verse: and a certain one said to him, `Sir, are those saved few?'  and he said unto them,

24.verse: `Be striving to go in through the straight gate, because  many, I say to you, will seek to go in, and shall not be able;

25.verse: from the time the master of the house may have risen up,  and may have shut the door, and ye may begin without to stand,  and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, lord, open to us, and  he answering shall say to you, I have not known you whence ye  are,

26.verse: then ye may begin to say, We did eat before thee, and did  drink, and in our broad places thou didst teach;

27.verse: and he shall say, I say to you, I have not known you  whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of the  unrighteousness.

28.verse: `There shall be there the weeping and the gnashing of the  teeth, when ye may see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all  the prophets, in the reign of God, and yourselves being cast  out without;

29.verse: and they shall come from east and west, and from north and  south, and shall recline in the reign of God,

30.verse: and lo, there are last who shall be first, and there are  first who shall be last.'

31.verse: On that day there came near certain Pharisees, saying to  him, `Go forth, and be going on hence, for Herod doth wish to  kill thee;'

32.verse: and he said to them, `Having gone, say to this fox, Lo, I  cast forth demons, and perfect cures to-day and to-morrow, and  the third [day] I am being perfected;

33.verse: but it behoveth me to-day, and to-morrow, and the [day]  following, to go on, because it is not possible for a prophet  to perish out of Jerusalem.

34.verse: `Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that is killing the prophets, and  stoning those sent unto her, how often did I will to gather  together thy children, as a hen her brood under the wings, and  ye did not will.

35.verse: `Lo, your house is being left to you desolate, and verily  I say to you -- ye may not see me, till it may come, when ye  may say, Blessed [is] he who is coming in the name of the  Lord.'

1.verse: And it came to pass, on his going into the house of a  certain one of the chiefs of the Pharisees, on a sabbath, to  eat bread, that they were watching him,

2.verse: and lo, there was a certain dropsical man before him;

3.verse: and Jesus answering spake to the lawyers and Pharisees,  saying, `Is it lawful on the sabbath-day to heal?'

4.verse: and they were silent, and having taken hold of [him], he  healed him, and let [him] go;

5.verse: and answering them he said, `Of which of you shall an ass  or ox fall into a pit, and he will not immediately draw it up  on the sabbath-day?'

6.verse: and they were not able to answer him again unto these  things.

7.verse: And he spake a simile unto those called, marking how they  were choosing out the first couches, saying unto them,

8.verse: `When thou mayest be called by any one to marriage-feasts,  thou mayest not recline on the first couch, lest a more  honourable than thou may have been called by him,

9.verse: and he who did call thee and him having come shall say to  thee, Give to this one place, and then thou mayest begin with  shame to occupy the last place.

10.verse: `But, when thou mayest be called, having gone on, recline  in the last place, that when he who called thee may come, he  may say to thee, Friend, come up higher; then thou shalt have  glory before those reclining with thee;

11.verse: because every one who is exalting himself shall be  humbled, and he who is humbling himself shall be exalted.'

12.verse: And he said also to him who did call him, `When thou  mayest make a dinner or a supper, be not calling thy friends,  nor thy brethren, nor thy kindred, nor rich neighbours, lest  they may also call thee again, and a recompense may come to  thee;

13.verse: but when thou mayest make a feast, be calling poor,  maimed, lame, blind,

14.verse: and happy thou shalt be, because they have not to  recompense thee, for it shall be recompensed to thee in the  rising again of the righteous.'

15.verse: And one of those reclining with him, having heard these  things, said to him, `Happy [is] he who shall eat bread in the  reign of God;'

16.verse: and he said to him, `A certain man made a great supper,  and called many,

17.verse: and he sent his servant at the hour of the supper to say  to those having been called, Be coming, because now are all  things ready.

18.verse: `And they began with one consent all to excuse themselves:  The first said to him, A field I bought, and I have need to go  forth and see it; I beg of thee, have me excused.

19.verse: `And another said, Five yoke of oxen I bought, and I go on  to prove them; I beg of thee, have me excused:

20.verse: and another said, A wife I married, and because of this I  am not able to come.

21.verse: `And that servant having come, told to his lord these  things, then the master of the house, having been angry, said  to his servant, Go forth quickly to the broad places and lanes  of the city, and the poor, and maimed, and lame, and blind,  bring in hither.

22.verse: `And the servant said, Sir, it hath been done as thou  didst command, and still there is room.

23.verse: `And the lord said unto the servant, Go forth to the ways  and hedges, and constrain to come in, that my house may be  filled;

24.verse: for I say to you, that none of those men who have been  called shall taste of my supper.'

25.verse: And there were going on with him great multitudes, and  having turned, he said unto them,

26.verse: `If any one doth come unto me, and doth not hate his own  father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brothers, and  sisters, and yet even his own life, he is not able to be my  disciple;

27.verse: and whoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, is  not able to be my disciple.

28.verse: `For who of you, willing to build a tower, doth not first,  having sat down, count the expense, whether he have the things  for completing?

29.verse: lest that he having laid a foundation, and not being able  to finish, all who are beholding may begin to mock him,

30.verse: saying -- This man began to build, and was not able to  finish.

31.verse: `Or what king going on to engage with another king in war,  doth not, having sat down, first consult if he be able with  ten thousand to meet him who with twenty thousand is coming  against him?

32.verse: and if not so -- he being yet a long way off -- having  sent an embassy, he doth ask the things for peace.

33.verse: `So, then, every one of you who doth not take leave of all  that he himself hath, is not able to be my disciple.

34.verse: `The salt [is] good, but if the salt doth become  tasteless, with what shall it be seasoned?

35.verse: neither for land nor for manure is it fit -- they cast it  without. He who is having ears to hear -- let him hear.'

1.verse: And all the tax-gatherers and the sinners were coming nigh  to him, to hear him,

2.verse: and the Pharisees and the scribes were murmuring, saying --  This one doth receive sinners, and doth eat with them.'

3.verse: And he spake unto them this simile, saying,

4.verse: `What man of you having a hundred sheep, and having lost  one out of them, doth not leave behind the ninety-nine in the  wilderness, and go on after the lost one, till he may find it?

5.verse: and having found, he doth lay [it] on his shoulders  rejoicing,

6.verse: and having come to the house, he doth call together the  friends and the neighbours, saying to them, Rejoice with me,  because I found my sheep -- the lost one.

7.verse: `I say to you, that so joy shall be in the heaven over one  sinner reforming, rather than over ninety-nine righteous men,  who have no need of reformation.

8.verse: `Or what woman having ten drachms, if she may lose one  drachm, doth not light a lamp, and sweep the house, and seek  carefully till that she may find?

9.verse: and having found, she doth call together the female friends  and the neighbours, saying, Rejoice with me, for I found the  drachm that I lost.

10.verse: `So I say to you, joy doth come before the messengers of  God over one sinner reforming.'

11.verse: And he said, `A certain man had two sons,

12.verse: and the younger of them said to the father, Father, give  me the portion of the substance falling to [me], and he  divided to them the living.

13.verse: `And not many days after, having gathered all together,  the younger son went abroad to a far country, and there he  scattered his substance, living riotously;

14.verse: and he having spent all, there came a mighty famine on  that country, and himself began to be in want;

15.verse: and having gone on, he joined himself to one of the  citizens of that country, and he sent him to the fields to feed  swine,

16.verse: and he was desirous to fill his belly from the husks that  the swine were eating, and no one was giving to him.

17.verse: `And having come to himself, he said, How many hirelings  of my father have a superabundance of bread, and I here with  hunger am perishing!

18.verse: having risen, I will go on unto my father, and will say to  him, Father, I did sin -- to the heaven, and before thee,

19.verse: and no more am I worthy to be called thy son; make me as  one of thy hirelings.

20.verse: `And having risen, he went unto his own father, and he  being yet far distant, his father saw him, and was moved with  compassion, and having ran he fell upon his neck and kissed  him;

21.verse: and the son said to him, Father, I did sin -- to the  heaven, and before thee, and no more am I worthy to be called  thy son.

22.verse: `And the father said unto his servants, Bring forth the  first robe, and clothe him, and give a ring for his hand, and  sandals for the feet;

23.verse: and having brought the fatted calf, kill [it], and having  eaten, we may be merry,

24.verse: because this my son was dead, and did live again, and he  was lost, and was found; and they began to be merry.

25.verse: `And his elder son was in a field, and as, coming, he drew  nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing,

26.verse: and having called near one of the young men, he was  inquiring what these things might be,

27.verse: and he said to him -- Thy brother is arrived, and thy  father did kill the fatted calf, because in health he did  receive him back.

28.verse: `And he was angry, and would not go in, therefore his  father, having come forth, was entreating him;

29.verse: and he answering said to the father, Lo, so many years I  do serve thee, and never thy command did I transgress, and to  me thou didst never give a kid, that with my friends I might  make merry;

30.verse: but when thy son -- this one who did devour thy living  with harlots -- came, thou didst kill to him the fatted calf.

31.verse: `And he said to him, Child, thou art always with me, and  all my things are thine;

32.verse: but to be merry, and to be glad, it was needful, because  this thy brother was dead, and did live again, he was lost,  and was found.'

1.verse: And he said also unto his disciples, `A certain man was  rich, who had a steward, and he was accused to him as  scattering his goods;

2.verse: and having called him, he said to him, What [is] this I  hear about thee? render the account of thy stewardship, for  thou mayest not any longer be steward.

3.verse: `And the steward said in himself, What shall I do, because  my lord doth take away the stewardship from me? to dig I am  not able, to beg I am ashamed: --

4.verse: I have known what I shall do, that, when I may be removed  from the stewardship, they may receive me to their houses.

5.verse: `And having called near each one of his lord's debtors, he  said to the first, How much dost thou owe to my lord?

6.verse: and he said, A hundred baths of oil; and he said to him,  Take thy bill, and having sat down write fifty.

7.verse: `Afterward to another he said, And thou, how much dost thou  owe? and he said, A hundred cors of wheat; and he saith to  him, Take thy bill, and write eighty.

8.verse: `And the lord commended the unrighteous steward that he did  prudently, because the sons of this age are more prudent than  the sons of the light, in respect to their generation.

9.verse: and I say to you, Make to yourselves friends out of the  mammon of unrighteousness, that when ye may fail, they may  receive you to the age-during tabernacles.

10.verse: `He who is faithful in the least, [is] also faithful in  much; and he who in the least [is] unrighteous, is also  unrighteous in much;

11.verse: if, then, in the unrighteous mammon ye became not faithful  -- the true who will entrust to you?

12.verse: and if in the other's ye became not faithful -- your own,  who shall give to you?

13.verse: `No domestic is able to serve two lords, for either the  one he will hate, and the other he will love; or one he will  hold to, and of the other he will be heedless; ye are not able  to serve God and mammon.'

14.verse: And also the Pharisees, being lovers of money, were  hearing all these things, and were deriding him,

15.verse: and he said to them, `Ye are those declaring yourselves  righteous before men, but God doth know your hearts; because  that which among men is high, [is] abomination before God;

16.verse: the law and the prophets [are] till John; since then the  reign of God is proclaimed good news, and every one doth press  into it;

17.verse: and it is easier to the heaven and the earth to pass away,  than of the law one tittle to fall.

18.verse: `Every one who is sending away his wife, and marrying  another, doth commit adultery; and every one who is marrying  her sent away from a husband doth commit adultery.

19.verse: `And -- a certain man was rich, and was clothed in purple  and fine linen, making merry sumptuously every day,

20.verse: and there was a certain poor man, by name Lazarus, who was  laid at his porch, full of sores,

21.verse: and desiring to be filled from the crumbs that are falling  from the table of the rich man; yea, also the dogs, coming,  were licking his sores.

22.verse: `And it came to pass, that the poor man died, and that he  was carried away by the messengers to the bosom of Abraham --  and the rich man also died, and was buried;

23.verse: and in the hades having lifted up his eyes, being in  torments, he doth see Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his  bosom,

24.verse: and having cried, he said, Father Abraham, deal kindly  with me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his  finger in water, and may cool my tongue, because I am  distressed in this flame.

25.verse: `And Abraham said, Child, remember that thou did receive  -- thou -- thy good things in thy life, and Lazarus in like  manner the evil things, and now he is comforted, and thou art  distressed;

26.verse: and besides all these things, between us and you a great  chasm is fixed, so that they who are willing to go over from  hence unto you are not able, nor do they from thence to us pass  through.

27.verse: `And he said, I pray thee, then, father, that thou mayest  send him to the house of my father,

28.verse: for I have five brothers, so that he may thoroughly  testify to them, that they also may not come to this place of  torment.

29.verse: `Abraham saith to him, They have Moses and the prophets,  let them hear them;

30.verse: and he said, No, father Abraham, but if any one from the  dead may go unto them, they will reform.

31.verse: And he said to him, If Moses and the prophets they do not  hear, neither if one may rise out of the dead will they be  persuaded.'

1.verse: And he said unto the disciples, `It is impossible for the  stumbling blocks not to come, but wo [to him] through whom they  come;

2.verse: it is more profitable to him if a weighty millstone is put  round about his neck, and he hath been cast into the sea, than  that he may cause one of these little ones to stumble.

3.verse: `Take heed to yourselves, and, if thy brother may sin in  regard to thee, rebuke him, and if he may reform, forgive him,

4.verse: and if seven times in the day he may sin against thee, and  seven times in the day may turn back to thee, saying, I  reform; thou shalt forgive him.'

5.verse: And the apostles said to the Lord, `Add to us faith;'

6.verse: and the Lord said, `If ye had faith as a grain of mustard,  ye would have said to this sycamine, Be uprooted, and be  planted in the sea, and it would have obeyed you.

7.verse: `But, who is he of you -- having a servant ploughing or  feeding -- who, to him having come in out of the field, will  say, Having come near, recline at meat?

8.verse: but will not [rather] say to him, Prepare what I may sup,  and having girded thyself about, minister to me, till I eat and  drink, and after these things thou shalt eat and drink?

9.verse: Hath he favour to that servant because he did the things  directed? I think not.

10.verse: `So also ye, when ye may have done all the things directed  you, say -- We are unprofitable servants, because that which we  owed to do -- we have done.'

11.verse: And it came to pass, in his going on to Jerusalem, that he  passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee,

12.verse: and he entering into a certain village, there met him ten  leprous men, who stood afar off,

13.verse: and they lifted up the voice, saying, `Jesus, master, deal  kindly with us;'

14.verse: and having seen [them], he said to them, `Having gone on,  shew yourselves to the priests;' and it came to pass, in their  going, they were cleansed,

15.verse: and one of them having seen that he was healed did turn  back, with a loud voice glorifying God,

16.verse: and he fell upon [his] face at his feet, giving thanks to  him, and he was a Samaritan.

17.verse: And Jesus answering said, `Were not the ten cleansed, and  the nine -- where?

18.verse: There were not found who did turn back to give glory to  God, except this alien;'

19.verse: and he said to him, `Having risen, be going on, thy faith  hath saved thee.'

20.verse: And having been questioned by the Pharisees, when the  reign of God doth come, he answered them, and said, `The reign  of God doth not come with observation;

21.verse: nor shall they say, Lo, here; or lo, there; for lo, the  reign of God is within you.'

22.verse: And he said unto his disciples, `Days will come, when ye  shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and ye  shall not behold [it];

23.verse: and they shall say to you, Lo, here; or lo, there; ye may  not go away, nor follow;

24.verse: for as the lightning that is lightening out of the one  [part] under heaven, to the other part under heaven doth shine,  so shall be also the Son of Man in his day;

25.verse: and first it behoveth him to suffer many things, and to be  rejected by this generation.

26.verse: `And, as it came to pass in the days of Noah, so shall it  be also in the days of the Son of Man;

27.verse: they were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying,  they were given in marriage, till the day that Noah entered  into the ark, and the deluge came, and destroyed all;

28.verse: in like manner also, as it came to pass in the days of  Lot; they were eating, they were drinking, they were buying,  they were selling, they were planting, they were building;

29.verse: and on the day Lot went forth from Sodom, He rained fire  and brimstone from heaven, and destroyed all.

30.verse: `According to these things it shall be, in the day the Son  of Man is revealed;

31.verse: in that day, he who shall be on the house top, and his  vessels in the house, let him not come down to take them away;  and he in the field, in like manner, let him not turn backward;

32.verse: remember the wife of Lot.

33.verse: Whoever may seek to save his life, shall lose it; and  whoever may lose it, shall preserve it.

34.verse: `I say to you, In that night, there shall be two men on  one couch, the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left;

35.verse: two women shall be grinding at the same place together,  the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left;

36.verse: two men shall be in the field, the one shall be taken, and  the other left.'

37.verse: And they answering say to him, `Where, sir?' and he said  to them, `Where the body [is], there will the eagles be  gathered together.'

1.verse: And he spake also a simile to them, that it behoveth [us]  always to pray, and not to faint,

2.verse: saying, `A certain judge was in a certain city -- God he is  not fearing, and man he is not regarding --

3.verse: and a widow was in that city, and she was coming unto him,  saying, Do me justice on my opponent,

4.verse: and he would not for a time, but after these things he said  in himself, Even if God I do not fear, and man do not regard,

5.verse: yet because this widow doth give me trouble, I will do her  justice, lest, perpetually coming, she may plague me.'

6.verse: And the Lord said, `Hear ye what the unrighteous judge  saith:

7.verse: and shall not God execute the justice to His choice ones,  who are crying unto Him day and night -- bearing long in  regard to them?

8.verse: I say to you, that He will execute the justice to them  quickly; but the Son of Man having come, shall he find the  faith upon the earth?'

9.verse: And he spake also unto certain who have been trusting in  themselves that they were righteous, and have been despising  the rest, this simile:

10.verse: `Two men went up to the temple to pray, the one a  Pharisee, and the other a tax-gatherer;

11.verse: the Pharisee having stood by himself, thus prayed: God, I  thank Thee that I am not as the rest of men, rapacious,  unrighteous, adulterers, or even as this tax-gatherer;

12.verse: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all things --  as many as I possess.

13.verse: `And the tax-gatherer, having stood afar off, would not  even the eyes lift up to the heaven, but was smiting on his  breast, saying, God be propitious to me -- the sinner!

14.verse: I say to you, this one went down declared righteous, to  his house, rather than that one: for every one who is exalting  himself shall be humbled, and he who is humbling himself shall  be exalted.'

15.verse: And they were bringing near also the babes, that he may  touch them, and the disciples having seen did rebuke them,

16.verse: and Jesus having called them near, said, `Suffer the  little children to come unto me, and forbid them not, for of  such is the reign of God;

17.verse: verily I say to you, Whoever may not receive the reign of  God as a little child, may not enter into it.'

18.verse: And a certain ruler questioned him, saying, `Good teacher,  what having done -- shall I inherit life age-during?'

19.verse: And Jesus said to him, `Why me dost thou call good? no one  [is] good, except One -- God;

20.verse: the commands thou hast known: Thou mayest not commit  adultery, Thou mayest do no murder, Thou mayest not steal, Thou  mayest not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy  mother.'

21.verse: And he said, `All these I did keep from my youth;'

22.verse: and having heard these things, Jesus said to him, `Yet one  thing to thee is lacking; all things -- as many as thou hast --  sell, and distribute to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure  in heaven, and come, be following me;'

23.verse: and he, having heard these things, became very sorrowful,  for he was exceeding rich.

24.verse: And Jesus having seen him become very sorrowful, said,  `How hardly shall those having riches enter into the reign of  God!

25.verse: for it is easier for a camel through the eye of a needle  to enter, than for a rich man into the reign of God to enter.'

26.verse: And those who heard, said, `And who is able to be saved?'

27.verse: and he said, `The things impossible with men are possible  with God.'

28.verse: And Peter said, `Lo, we left all, and did follow thee;'

29.verse: and he said to them, `Verily I say to you, that there is  not one who left house, or parents, or brothers, or wife, or  children, for the sake of the reign of God,

30.verse: who may not receive back manifold more in this time, and  in the coming age, life age-during.'

31.verse: And having taken the twelve aside, he said unto them, `Lo,  we go up to Jerusalem, and all things shall be completed --  that have been written through the prophets -- to the Son of  Man,

32.verse: for he shall be delivered up to the nations, and shall be  mocked, and insulted, and spit upon,

33.verse: and having scourged they shall put him to death, and on  the third day he shall rise again.'

34.verse: And they none of these things understood, and this saying  was hid from them, and they were not knowing the things said.

35.verse: And it came to pass, in his coming nigh to Jericho, a  certain blind man was sitting beside the way begging,

36.verse: and having heard a multitude going by, he was inquiring  what this may be,

37.verse: and they brought him word that Jesus the Nazarene doth  pass by,

38.verse: and he cried out, saying, `Jesus, Son of David, deal  kindly with me;'

39.verse: and those going before were rebuking him, that he might be  silent, but he was much more crying out, `Son of David, deal  kindly with me.'

40.verse: And Jesus having stood, commanded him to be brought unto  him, and he having come nigh, he questioned him,

41.verse: saying, `What wilt thou I shall do to thee?' and he said,  `Sir, that I may receive sight.'

42.verse: And Jesus said to him, `Receive thy sight; thy faith hath  saved thee;'

43.verse: and presently he did receive sight, and was following him,  glorifying God; and all the people, having seen, did give  praise to God.

1.verse: And having entered, he was passing through Jericho,

2.verse: and lo, a man, by name called Zaccheus, and he was a chief  tax-gatherer, and he was rich,

3.verse: and he was seeking to see Jesus, who he is, and was not  able for the multitude, because in stature he was small,

4.verse: and having run forward before, he went up on a sycamore,  that he may see him, because through that [way] he was about to  pass by.

5.verse: And as Jesus came up to the place, having looked up, he saw  him, and said unto him, `Zaccheus, having hastened, come down,  for to-day in thy house it behoveth me to remain;'

6.verse: and he having hastened did come down, and did receive him  rejoicing;

7.verse: and having seen [it], they were all murmuring, saying --  `With a sinful man he went in to lodge!'

8.verse: And Zaccheus having stood, said unto the Lord, `Lo, the  half of my goods, sir, I give to the poor, and if of any one  anything I did take by false accusation, I give back  fourfold.'

9.verse: And Jesus said unto him -- `To-day salvation did come to  this house, inasmuch as he also is a son of Abraham;

10.verse: for the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.'

11.verse: And while they are hearing these things, having added he  spake a simile, because of his being nigh to Jerusalem, and of  their thinking that the reign of God is about presently to be  made manifest.

12.verse: He said therefore, `A certain man of birth went on to a  far country, to take to himself a kingdom, and to return,

13.verse: and having called ten servants of his own, he gave to them  ten pounds, and said unto them, Do business -- till I come;

14.verse: and his citizens were hating him, and did send an embassy  after him, saying, We do not wish this one to reign over us.

15.verse: `And it came to pass, on his coming back, having taken the  kingdom, that he commanded these servants to be called to him,  to whom he gave the money, that he might know what any one had  done in business.

16.verse: `And the first came near, saying, Sir, thy pound did gain  ten pounds;

17.verse: and he said to him, Well done, good servant, because in a  very little thou didst become faithful, be having authority  over ten cities.

18.verse: `And the second came, saying, Sir, thy pound made five  pounds;

19.verse: and he said also to this one, And thou, become thou over  five cities.

20.verse: `And another came, saying, Sir, lo, thy pound, that I had  lying away in a napkin;

21.verse: for I was afraid of thee, because thou art an austere man;  thou takest up what thou didst not lay down, and reapest what  thou didst not sow.

22.verse: `And he saith to him, Out of thy mouth I will judge thee,  evil servant: thou knewest that I am an austere man, taking up  what I did not lay down, and reaping what I did not sow!

23.verse: and wherefore didst thou not give my money to the bank,  and I, having come, with interest might have received it?

24.verse: `And to those standing by he said, Take from him the  pound, and give to him having the ten pounds --

25.verse: (and they said to him, Sir, he hath ten pounds) --

26.verse: for I say to you, that to every one having shall be given,  and from him not having, also what he hath shall be taken from  him,

27.verse: but those my enemies, who did not wish me to reign over  them, bring hither and slay before me.'

28.verse: And having said these things, he went on before, going up  to Jerusalem.

29.verse: And it came to pass, as he came nigh to Bethphage and  Bethany, unto the mount called of the Olives, he sent two of  his disciples,

30.verse: having said, Go away to the village over-against, in  which, entering into, ye shall find a colt bound, on which no  one of men did ever sit, having loosed it, bring [it];

31.verse: and if any one doth question you, Wherefore do ye loose  [it]? thus ye shall say to him -- The Lord hath need of it.'

32.verse: And those sent, having gone away, found according as he  said to them,

33.verse: and while they are loosing the colt, its owners said unto  them, `Why loose ye the colt?'

34.verse: and they said, `The Lord hath need of it;'

35.verse: and they brought it unto Jesus, and having cast their  garments upon the colt, they did set Jesus upon it.

36.verse: And as he is going, they were spreading their garments in  the way,

37.verse: and as he is coming nigh now, at the descent of the mount  of the Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began  rejoicing to praise God with a great voice for all the mighty  works they had seen,

38.verse: saying, `blessed [is] he who is coming, a king in the name  of the Lord; peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.'

39.verse: And certain of the Pharisees from the multitude said unto  him, `Teacher, rebuke thy disciples;'

40.verse: and he answering said to them, `I say to you, that, if  these shall be silent, the stones will cry out!'

41.verse: And when he came nigh, having seen the city, he wept over  it,

42.verse: saying -- `If thou didst know, even thou, at least in this  thy day, the things for thy peace; but now they were hid from  thine eyes.

43.verse: `Because days shall come upon thee, and thine enemies  shall cast around thee a rampart, and compass thee round, and  press thee on every side,

44.verse: and lay thee low, and thy children within thee, and they  shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone, because thou  didst not know the time of thy inspection.'

45.verse: And having entered into the temple, he began to cast forth  those selling in it, and those buying,

46.verse: saying to them, `It hath been written, My house is a house  of prayer -- but ye made it a den of robbers.'

47.verse: And he was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief  priests and the scribes were seeking to destroy him -- also  the chiefs of the people --

48.verse: and they were not finding what they shall do, for all the  people were hanging on him, hearing him.

1.verse: And it came to pass, on one of those days, as he is  teaching the people in the temple, and proclaiming good news,  the chief priests and the scribes, with the elders, came upon  [him],

2.verse: and spake unto him, saying, `Tell us by what authority thou  dost these things? or who is he that gave to thee this  authority?'

3.verse: And he answering said unto them, `I will question you -- I  also -- one thing, and tell me:

4.verse: the baptism of John, from heaven was it, or from men?'

5.verse: And they reasoned with themselves, saying -- `If we may  say, From heaven, he will say, Wherefore, then, did ye not  believe him?

6.verse: and if we may say, From men, all the people will stone us,  for they are having been persuaded John to be a prophet.'

7.verse: And they answered, that they knew not whence [it was],

8.verse: and Jesus said to them, `Neither do I say to you by what  authority I do these things.'

9.verse: And he began to speak unto the people this simile: `A  certain man planted a vineyard, and gave it out to husbandmen,  and went abroad for a long time,

10.verse: and at the season he sent unto the husbandmen a servant,  that from the fruit of the vineyard they may give to him, but  the husbandmen having beat him, did send [him] away empty.

11.verse: `And he added to send another servant, and they that one  also having beaten and dishonoured, did send away empty;

12.verse: and he added to send a third, and this one also, having  wounded, they did cast out.

13.verse: `And the owner of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I  will send my son -- the beloved, perhaps having seen this one,  they will do reverence;

14.verse: and having seen him, the husbandmen reasoned among  themselves, saying, This is the heir; come, we may kill him,  that the inheritance may become ours;

15.verse: and having cast him outside of the vineyard, they killed  [him]; what, then, shall the owner of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come, and destroy these husbandmen, and will give  the vineyard to others.' And having heard, they said, `Let it  not be!'

17.verse: and he, having looked upon them, said, `What, then, is  this that hath been written: A stone that the builders rejected  -- this became head of a corner?

18.verse: every one who hath fallen on that stone shall be broken,  and on whom it may fall, it will crush him to pieces.'

19.verse: And the chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands  on him in that hour, and they feared the people, for they knew  that against them he spake this simile.

20.verse: And, having watched [him], they sent forth liers in wait,  feigning themselves to be righteous, that they might take hold  of his word, to deliver him up to the rule and to the authority  of the governor,

21.verse: and they questioned him, saying, `Teacher, we have known  that thou dost say and teach rightly, and dost not accept a  person, but in truth the way of God dost teach;

22.verse: Is it lawful to us to give tribute to Caesar or not?'

23.verse: And he, having perceived their craftiness, said unto them,  `Why me do ye tempt?

24.verse: shew me a denary; of whom hath it an image and  superscription?' and they answering said, `Of Caesar:'

25.verse: and he said to them, `Give back, therefore, the things of  Caesar to Caesar, and the things of God to God;'

26.verse: and they were not able to take hold on his saying before  the people, and having wondered at his answer, they were  silent.

27.verse: And certain of the Sadducees, who are denying that there  is a rising again, having come near, questioned him,

28.verse: saying, `Teacher, Moses wrote to us, If any one's brother  may die, having a wife, and he may die childless -- that his  brother may take the wife, and may raise up seed to his  brother.

29.verse: `There were, then, seven brothers, and the first having  taken a wife, died childless,

30.verse: and the second took the wife, and he died childless,

31.verse: and the third took her, and in like manner also the seven  -- they left not children, and they died;

32.verse: and last of all died also the woman:

33.verse: in the rising again, then, of which of them doth she  become wife? -- for the seven had her as wife.'

34.verse: And Jesus answering said to them, `The sons of this age do  marry and are given in marriage,

35.verse: but those accounted worthy to obtain that age, and the  rising again that is out of the dead, neither marry, nor are  they given in marriage;

36.verse: for neither are they able to die any more -- for they are  like messengers -- and they are sons of God, being sons of the  rising again.

37.verse: `And that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the  Bush, since he doth call the Lord, the God of Abraham, and the  God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob;

38.verse: and He is not a God of dead men, but of living, for all  live to Him.'

39.verse: And certain of the scribes answering said, `Teacher, thou  didst say well;'

40.verse: and no more durst they question him anything.

41.verse: And he said unto them, `How do they say the Christ to be  son of David,

42.verse: and David himself saith in the Book of Psalms, The Lord  said to my lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

43.verse: till I shall make thine enemies thy footstool;

44.verse: David, then, doth call him lord, and how is he his son?'

45.verse: And, all the people hearing, he said to his disciples,

46.verse: `Take heed of the scribes, who are wishing to walk in long  robes, and are loving salutations in the markets, and first  seats in the synagogues, and first couches in the suppers,

47.verse: who devour the houses of the widows, and for a pretence  make long prayers, these shall receive more abundant  judgment.'

1.verse: And having looked up, he saw those who did cast their gifts  to the treasury -- rich men,

2.verse: and he saw also a certain poor widow casting there two  mites,

3.verse: and he said, `Truly I say to you, that this poor widow did  cast in more than all;

4.verse: for all these out of their superabundance did cast into the  gifts to God, but this one out of her want, all the living  that she had, did cast in.'

5.verse: And certain saying about the temple, that with goodly  stones and devoted things it hath been adorned, he said,

6.verse: `These things that ye behold -- days will come, in which  there shall not be left a stone upon a stone, that shall not be  thrown down.'

7.verse: And they questioned him, saying, `Teacher, when, then,  shall these things be? and what [is] the sign when these  things may be about to happen?'

8.verse: And he said, `See -- ye may not be led astray, for many  shall come in my name, saying -- I am [he], and the time hath  come nigh; go not on then after them;

9.verse: and when ye may hear of wars and uprisings, be not  terrified, for it behoveth these things to happen first, but  the end [is] not immediately.'

10.verse: Then said he to them, `Nation shall rise against nation,  and kingdom against kingdom,

11.verse: great shakings also in every place, and famines, and  pestilences, there shall be; fearful things also, and great  signs from heaven there shall be;

12.verse: and before all these, they shall lay on you their hands,  and persecute, delivering up to synagogues and prisons, being  brought before kings and governors for my name's sake;

13.verse: and it shall become to you for a testimony.

14.verse: `Settle, then, to your hearts, not to meditate beforehand  to reply,

15.verse: for I will give to you a mouth and wisdom that all your  opposers shall not be able to refute or resist.

16.verse: `And ye shall be delivered up also by parents, and  brothers, and kindred, and friends, and they shall put of you  to death;

17.verse: and ye shall be hated by all because of my name --

18.verse: and a hair out of your head shall not perish;

19.verse: in your patience possess ye your souls.

20.verse: `And when ye may see Jerusalem surrounded by encampments,  then know that come nigh did her desolation;

21.verse: then those in Judea, let them flee to the mountains; and  those in her midst, let them depart out; and those in the  countries, let them not come in to her;

22.verse: because these are days of vengeance, to fulfil all things  that have been written.

23.verse: `And wo to those with child, and to those giving suck, in  those days; for there shall be great distress on the land, and  wrath on this people;

24.verse: and they shall fall by the mouth of the sword, and shall  be led captive to all the nations, and Jerusalem shall be  trodden down by nations, till the times of nations be  fulfilled.

25.verse: `And there shall be signs in sun, and moon, and stars, and  on the land [is] distress of nations with perplexity, sea and  billow roaring;

26.verse: men fainting at heart from fear, and expectation of the  things coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens  shall be shaken.

27.verse: `And then they shall see the Son of Man, coming in a  cloud, with power and much glory;

28.verse: and these things beginning to happen bend yourselves back,  and lift up your heads, because your redemption doth draw  nigh.'

29.verse: And he spake a simile to them: `See the fig-tree, and all  the trees,

30.verse: when they may now cast forth, having seen, of yourselves  ye know that now is the summer nigh;

31.verse: so also ye, when ye may see these things happening, ye  know that near is the reign of God;

32.verse: verily I say to you -- This generation may not pass away  till all may have come to pass;

33.verse: the heaven and the earth shall pass away, but my words may  not pass away.

34.verse: `And take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts may be  weighed down with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and anxieties of  life, and suddenly that day may come on you,

35.verse: for as a snare it shall come on all those dwelling on the  face of all the land,

36.verse: watch ye, then, in every season, praying that ye may be  accounted worthy to escape all these things that are about to  come to pass, and to stand before the Son of Man.'

37.verse: And he was during the days in the temple teaching, and  during the nights, going forth, he was lodging at the mount  called of Olives;

38.verse: and all the people were coming early unto him in the  temple to hear him.

1.verse: And the feast of the unleavened food was coming nigh, that  is called Passover,

2.verse: and the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they  may take him up, for they were afraid of the people.

3.verse: And the Adversary entered into Judas, who is surnamed  Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve,

4.verse: and he, having gone away, spake with the chief priests and  the magistrates, how he might deliver him up to them,

5.verse: and they rejoiced, and covenanted to give him money,

6.verse: and he agreed, and was seeking a favourable season to  deliver him up to them without tumult.

7.verse: And the day of the unleavened food came, in which it was  behoving the passover to be sacrificed,

8.verse: and he sent Peter and John, saying, `Having gone on,  prepare to us the passover, that we may eat;'

9.verse: and they said to him, `Where wilt thou that we might  prepare?'

10.verse: And he said to them, `Lo, in your entering into the city,  there shall meet you a man, bearing a pitcher of water, follow  him to the house where he doth go in,

11.verse: and ye shall say to the master of the house, The Teacher  saith to thee, Where is the guest-chamber where the passover  with my disciples I may eat?

12.verse: and he shall show you a large upper room furnished, there  make ready;'

13.verse: and they, having gone away, found as he hath said to them,  and they made ready the passover.

14.verse: And when the hour come, he reclined (at meat), and the  twelve apostles with him,

15.verse: and he said unto them, `With desire I did desire to eat  this passover with you before my suffering,

16.verse: for I say to you, that no more may I eat of it till it may  be fulfilled in the reign of God.'

17.verse: And having taken a cup, having given thanks, he said,  `Take this and divide to yourselves,

18.verse: for I say to you that I may not drink of the produce of  the vine till the reign of God may come.'

19.verse: And having taken bread, having given thanks, he brake and  gave to them, saying, `This is my body, that for you is being  given, this do ye -- to remembrance of me.'

20.verse: In like manner, also, the cup after the supping, saying,  `This cup [is] the new covenant in my blood, that for you is  being poured forth.

21.verse: `But, lo, the hand of him delivering me up [is] with me on  the table,

22.verse: and indeed the Son of Man doth go according to what hath  been determined; but wo to that man through whom he is being  delivered up.'

23.verse: And they began to reason among themselves, who then of  them it may be, who is about to do this thing.

24.verse: And there happened also a strife among them -- who of them  is accounted to be greater.

25.verse: And he said to them, `The kings of the nations do exercise  lordship over them, and those exercising authority upon them  are called benefactors;

26.verse: but ye [are] not so, but he who is greater among you --  let him be as the younger; and he who is leading, as he who is  ministering;

27.verse: for who is greater? he who is reclining (at meat), or he  who is ministering? is it not he who is reclining (at meat)?  and I -- I am in your midst as he who is ministering.

28.verse: `And ye -- ye are those who have remained with me in my  temptations,

29.verse: and I appoint to you, as my Father did appoint to me, a  kingdom,

30.verse: that ye may eat and may drink at my table, in my kingdom,  and may sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.'

31.verse: And the Lord said, `Simon, Simon, lo, the Adversary did  ask you for himself to sift as the wheat,

32.verse: and I besought for thee, that thy faith may not fail; and  thou, when thou didst turn, strengthen thy brethren.'

33.verse: And he said to him, `Sir, with thee I am ready both to  prison and to death to go;'

34.verse: and he said, `I say to thee, Peter, a cock shall not crow  to-day, before thrice thou mayest disown knowing me.'

35.verse: And he said to them, `When I sent you without bag, and  scrip, and sandals, did ye lack anything?' and they said,  `Nothing.'

36.verse: Then said he to them, `But, now, he who is having a bag,  let him take [it] up, and in like manner also a scrip; and he  who is not having, let him sell his garment, and buy a sword,

37.verse: for I say to you, that yet this that hath been written it  behoveth to be fulfilled in me: And with lawless ones he was  reckoned, for also the things concerning me have an end.'

38.verse: And they said, `Sir, lo, here [are] two swords;' and he  said to them, `It is sufficient.'

39.verse: And having gone forth, he went on, according to custom, to  the mount of the Olives, and his disciples also followed him,

40.verse: and having come to the place, he said to them, `Pray ye  not to enter into temptation.'

41.verse: And he was withdrawn from them, as it were a stone's cast,  and having fallen on the knees he was praying,

42.verse: saying, `Father, if Thou be counselling to make this cup  pass from me --; but, not my will, but Thine be done.' --

43.verse: And there appeared to him a messenger from heaven  strengthening him;

44.verse: and having been in agony, he was more earnestly praying,  and his sweat became, as it were, great drops of blood falling  upon the ground.

45.verse: And having risen up from the prayer, having come unto the  disciples, he found them sleeping from the sorrow,

46.verse: and he said to them, `Why do ye sleep? having risen, pray  that ye may not enter into temptation.'

47.verse: And while he is speaking, lo, a multitude, and he who is  called Judas, one of the twelve, was coming before them, and he  came nigh to Jesus to kiss him,

48.verse: and Jesus said to him, `Judas, with a kiss the Son of Man  dost thou deliver up?'

49.verse: And those about him, having seen what was about to be,  said to him, `Sir, shall we smite with a sword?'

50.verse: And a certain one of them smote the servant of the chief  priest, and took off his right ear,

51.verse: and Jesus answering said, `Suffer ye thus far,' and having  touched his ear, he healed him.

52.verse: And Jesus said to those having come upon him -- chief  priests, and magistrates of the temple, and elders -- `As upon  a robber have ye come forth, with swords and sticks?

53.verse: while daily I was with you in the temple, ye did stretch  forth no hands against me; but this is your hour and the power  of the darkness.'

54.verse: And having taken him, they led and brought him to the  house of the chief priest. And Peter was following afar off,

55.verse: and they having kindled a fire in the midst of the court,  and having sat down together, Peter was sitting in the midst  of them,

56.verse: and a certain maid having seen him sitting at the light,  and having earnestly looked at him, she said, `And this one  was with him!'

57.verse: and he disowned him, saying, `Woman, I have not known  him.'

58.verse: And after a little, another having seen him, said, `And  thou art of them!' and Peter said, `Man, I am not.'

59.verse: And one hour, as it were, having intervened, a certain  other was confidently affirming, saying, `Of a truth this one  also was with him, for he is also a Galilean;'

60.verse: and Peter said, `Man, I have not known what thou sayest;'  and presently, while he is speaking, a cock crew.

61.verse: And the Lord having turned did look on Peter, and Peter  remembered the word of the Lord, how he said to him -- `Before  a cock shall crow, thou mayest disown me thrice;'

62.verse: and Peter having gone without, wept bitterly.

63.verse: And the men who were holding Jesus were mocking him,  beating [him];

64.verse: and having blindfolded him, they were striking him on the  face, and were questioning him, saying, `Prophesy who he is  who smote thee?'

65.verse: and many other things, speaking evilly, they spake in  regard to him.

66.verse: And when it became day there was gathered together the  eldership of the people, chief priests also, and scribes, and  they led him up to their own sanhedrim,

67.verse: saying, `If thou be the Christ, tell us.' And he said to  them, `If I may tell you, ye will not believe;

68.verse: and if I also question [you], ye will not answer me or  send me away;

69.verse: henceforth, there shall be the Son of Man sitting on the  right hand of the power of God.'

70.verse: And they all said, `Thou, then, art the Son of God?' and  he said unto them, `Ye say [it], because I am;'

71.verse: and they said, `What need yet have we of testimony? for we  ourselves did hear [it] from his mouth.'

1.verse: And having risen, the whole multitude of them did lead him  to Pilate,

2.verse: and began to accuse him, saying, `This one we found  perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to  Caesar, saying himself to be Christ a king.'

3.verse: And Pilate questioned him, saying, `Thou art the king of  the Jews?' and he answering him, said, `Thou dost say [it].'

4.verse: And Pilate said unto the chief priests, and the multitude,  `I find no fault in this man;'

5.verse: and they were the more urgent, saying -- `He doth stir up  the people, teaching throughout the whole of Judea -- having  begun from Galilee -- unto this place.'

6.verse: And Pilate having heard of Galilee, questioned if the man  is a Galilean,

7.verse: and having known that he is from the jurisdiction of Herod,  he sent him back unto Herod, he being also in Jerusalem in  those days.

8.verse: And Herod having seen Jesus did rejoice exceedingly, for he  was wishing for a long [time] to see him, because of hearing  many things about him, and he was hoping some sign to see done  by him,

9.verse: and was questioning him in many words, and he answered him  nothing.

10.verse: And the chief priests and the scribes stood vehemently  accusing him,

11.verse: and Herod with his soldiers having set him at nought, and  having mocked, having put around him gorgeous apparel, did  send him back to Pilate,

12.verse: and both Pilate and Herod became friends on that day with  one another, for they were before at enmity between  themselves.

13.verse: And Pilate having called together the chief priests, and  the rulers, and the people,

14.verse: said unto them, `Ye brought to me this man as perverting  the people, and lo, I before you having examined, found in  this man no fault in those things ye bring forward against  him;

15.verse: no, nor yet Herod, for I sent you back unto him, and lo,  nothing worthy of death is having been done by him;

16.verse: having chastised, therefore, I will release him,'

17.verse: for it was necessary for him to release to them one at  every feast,

18.verse: and they cried out -- the whole multitude -- saying, `Away  with this one, and release to us Barabbas,'

19.verse: who had been, because of a certain sedition made in the  city, and murder, cast into prison.

20.verse: Pilate again then -- wishing to release Jesus -- called to  them,

21.verse: but they were calling out, saying, `Crucify, crucify him.'

22.verse: And he a third time said unto them, `Why, what evil did  he? no cause of death did I find in him; having chastised him,  then, I will release [him].'

23.verse: And they were pressing with loud voices asking him to be  crucified, and their voices, and those of the chief priests,  were prevailing,

24.verse: and Pilate gave judgment for their request being done,

25.verse: and he released him who because of sedition and murder  hath been cast into the prison, whom they were asking, and  Jesus he gave up to their will.

26.verse: And as they led him away, having taken hold on Simon, a  certain Cyrenian, coming from the field, they put on him the  cross, to bear [it] behind Jesus.

27.verse: And there was following him a great multitude of the  people, and of women, who also were beating themselves and  lamenting him,

28.verse: and Jesus having turned unto them, said, `Daughters of  Jerusalem, weep not for me, but for yourselves weep ye, and for  your children;

29.verse: for, lo, days do come, in which they shall say, Happy the  barren, and wombs that did not bare, and paps that did not give  suck;

30.verse: then they shall begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us,  and to the hills, Cover us; --

31.verse: for, if in the green tree they do these things -- in the  dry what may happen?'

32.verse: And there were also others -- two evil-doers -- with him,  to be put to death;

33.verse: and when they came to the place that is called Skull,  there they crucified him and the evil-doers, one on the right  hand and one on the left.

34.verse: And Jesus said, `Father, forgive them, for they have not  known what they do;' and parting his garments they cast a lot.

35.verse: And the people were standing, looking on, and the rulers  also were sneering with them, saying, `Others he saved, let him  save himself, if this be the Christ, the choice one of God.'

36.verse: And mocking him also were the soldiers, coming near and  offering vinegar to him,

37.verse: and saying, `If thou be the king of the Jews, save  thyself.'

38.verse: And there was also a superscription written over him, in  letters of Greek, and Roman, and Hebrew, `This is the King of  the Jews.'

39.verse: And one of the evil-doers who were hanged, was speaking  evil of him, saying, `If thou be the Christ, save thyself and  us.'

40.verse: And the other answering, was rebuking him, saying, `Dost  thou not even fear God, that thou art in the same judgment?

41.verse: and we indeed righteously, for things worthy of what we  did we receive back, but this one did nothing out of place;'

42.verse: and he said to Jesus, `Remember me, lord, when thou mayest  come in thy reign;'

43.verse: and Jesus said to him, `Verily I say to thee, To-day with  me thou shalt be in the paradise.'

44.verse: And it was, as it were, the sixth hour, and darkness came  over all the land till the ninth hour,

45.verse: and the sun was darkened, and the vail of the sanctuary  was rent in the midst,

46.verse: and having cried with a loud voice, Jesus said, `Father,  to Thy hands I commit my spirit;' and these things having said,  he breathed forth the spirit.

47.verse: And the centurion having seen what was done, did glorify  God, saying, `Really this man was righteous;'

48.verse: and all the multitudes who were come together to this  sight, beholding the things that came to pass, smiting their  breasts did turn back;

49.verse: and all his acquaintances stood afar off, and women who  did follow him from Galilee, beholding these things.

50.verse: And lo, a man, by name Joseph, being a counsellor, a man  good and righteous,

51.verse: -- he was not consenting to their counsel and deed -- from  Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who also himself was expecting  the reign of God,

52.verse: he, having gone near to Pilate, asked the body of Jesus,

53.verse: and having taken it down, he wrapped it in fine linen, and  placed it in a tomb hewn out, where no one was yet laid.

54.verse: And the day was a preparation, and sabbath was  approaching,

55.verse: and the women also who have come with him out of Galilee  having followed after, beheld the tomb, and how his body was  placed,

56.verse: and having turned back, they made ready spices and  ointments, and on the sabbath, indeed, they rested, according  to the command.

1.verse: And on the first of the sabbaths, at early dawn, they came  to the tomb, bearing the spices they made ready, and certain  [others] with them,

2.verse: and they found the stone having been rolled away from the  tomb,

3.verse: and having gone in, they found not the body of the Lord  Jesus.

4.verse: And it came to pass, while they are perplexed about this,  that lo, two men stood by them in glittering apparel,

5.verse: and on their having become afraid, and having inclined the  face to the earth, they said to them, `Why do ye seek the  living with the dead?

6.verse: he is not here, but was raised; remember how he spake to  you, being yet in Galilee,

7.verse: saying -- It behoveth the Son of Man to be delivered up to  the hands of sinful men, and to be crucified, and the third day  to rise again.'

8.verse: And they remembered his sayings,

9.verse: and having turned back from the tomb told all these things  to the eleven, and to all the rest.

10.verse: And it was the Magdalene Mary, and Joanna, and Mary of  James, and the other women with them, who told unto the  apostles these things,

11.verse: and their sayings appeared before them as idle talk, and  they were not believing them.

12.verse: And Peter having risen, did run to the tomb, and having  stooped down he seeth the linen clothes lying alone, and he  went away to his own home, wondering at that which was come to  pass.

13.verse: And, lo, two of them were going on during that day to a  village, distant sixty furlongs from Jerusalem, the name of  which [is] Emmaus,

14.verse: and they were conversing with one another about all these  things that have happened.

15.verse: And it came to pass in their conversing and reasoning  together, that Jesus himself, having come nigh, was going on  with them,

16.verse: and their eyes were holden so as not to know him,

17.verse: and he said unto them, `What [are] these words that ye  exchange with one another, walking, and ye are sad?'

18.verse: And the one, whose name was Cleopas, answering, said unto  him, `Art thou alone such a stranger in Jerusalem, that thou  hast not known the things that came to pass in it in these  days?'

19.verse: And he said to them, `What things?' And they said to him,  `The things about Jesus of Nazareth, who became a man -- a  prophet -- powerful in deed and word, before God and all the  people,

20.verse: how also the chief priests and our rulers did deliver him  up to a judgment of death, and crucified him;

21.verse: and we were hoping that he it is who is about to redeem  Israel, and also with all these things, this third day is  passing to-day, since these things happened.

22.verse: `And certain women of ours also astonished us, coming  early to the tomb,

23.verse: and not having found his body, they came, saying also to  have seen an apparition of messengers, who say he is alive,

24.verse: and certain of those with us went away unto the tomb, and  found as even the women said, and him they saw not.'

25.verse: And he said unto them, `O inconsiderate and slow in heart,  to believe on all that the prophets spake!

26.verse: Was it not behoving the Christ these things to suffer, and  to enter into his glory?'

27.verse: and having begun from Moses, and from all the prophets, he  was expounding to them in all the Writings the things about  himself.

28.verse: And they came nigh to the village whither they were going,  and he made an appearance of going on further,

29.verse: and they constrained him, saying, `Remain with us, for it  is toward evening,' and the day did decline, and he went in to  remain with them.

30.verse: And it came to pass, in his reclining (at meat) with them,  having taken the bread, he blessed, and having broken, he was  giving to them,

31.verse: and their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and  he became unseen by them.

32.verse: And they said one to another, `Was not our heart burning  within us, as he was speaking to us in the way, and as he was  opening up to us the Writings?'

33.verse: And they, having risen up the same hour, turned back to  Jerusalem, and found gathered together the eleven, and those  with them,

34.verse: saying -- `The Lord was raised indeed, and was seen by  Simon;'

35.verse: and they were telling the things in the way, and how he  was made known to them in the breaking of the bread,

36.verse: and as they are speaking these things, Jesus himself stood  in the midst of them, and saith to them, `Peace -- to you;'

37.verse: and being amazed, and becoming affrighted, they were  thinking themselves to see a spirit.

38.verse: And he said to them, `Why are ye troubled? and wherefore  do reasonings come up in your hearts?

39.verse: see my hands and my feet, that I am he; handle me and see,  because a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me  having.'

40.verse: And having said this, he shewed to them the hands and the  feet,

41.verse: and while they are not believing from the joy, and  wondering, he said to them, `Have ye anything here to eat?'

42.verse: and they gave to him part of a broiled fish, and of an  honeycomb,

43.verse: and having taken, he did eat before them,

44.verse: and he said to them, `These [are] the words that I spake  unto you, being yet with you, that it behoveth to be fulfilled  all the things that are written in the Law of Moses, and the  Prophets, and the Psalms, about me.'

45.verse: Then opened he up their understanding to understand the  Writings,

46.verse: and he said to them -- `Thus it hath been written, and  thus it was behoving the Christ to suffer, and to rise out of  the dead the third day,

47.verse: and reformation and remission of sins to be proclaimed in  his name to all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem:

48.verse: and ye -- ye are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: `And, lo, I do send the promise of my Father upon you, but  ye -- abide ye in the city of Jerusalem till ye be clothed with  power from on high.'

50.verse: And he led them forth without -- unto Bethany, and having  lifted up his hands he did bless them,

51.verse: and it came to pass, in his blessing them, he was parted  from them, and was borne up to the heaven;

52.verse: and they, having bowed before him, did turn back to  Jerusalem with great joy,

53.verse: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing  God. Amen.
